review: This location was quite cramped & a bit warm. It was a hot day so we elected to eat inside to enjoy the AC, which unfortunately wasn't working very well. The staff was very nice and our waiter Zack made our visit a 5 star experience. He was attentive, cordial & friendly. He made sure to refill our drinks when we were running low & offered great menu advice when my husband was unsure about what to order. My son and I shared the garlic alfredo pasta with mushrooms, we loved it! It was cheesy and had the perfect amount of mushrooms. My husband had the tortilla soup and avocado spring rolls, which he thoroughly enjoyed & of course we loved the bread!

So what do people from California do when they come to Hawaii?  They go to California Pizza Kitchen...LOL!  I picked up Tracy and since she was staying out in Kailua, I figured we'd eat somewhere out there.  The wait wasn't bad since it was late afternoon.  We ordered a couple of mules and the Thai Chicken Pizza, which is one of my favorites.  It is the right blend of flavors and it's just tasty.  Our server, "Josh" (not his real name...can't remember) was attentive without being intrusive. The second time we came here, our friend Deb had just flown in from San Jose.  Again, we laughed and decided to come here.  The wait was only about 10 minutes and we sat inside this time.  We ordered the same pizza, the spinach dip, and some dumplings.  Everything came out in a timely manner.  Our server, "Jessica" (not her real name...can't remember), was friendly and took great care of us!  I believe the manager, "Sharon" (not her real name...can't remember), even stopped by to see how everything was.   Maybe it was the fact that I kept taking pictures of our food that we had great service.  Maybe they thought we were from corporate checking up on them...after all, we are from California...LOL!  I think most of the impatient reviewers on here have a high expectation for a chain restaurant that's in Hawaii...one of the chillest places to visit.  Or if they came in "Hangry"...20 minutes will seem like forever.   My two visits were great!  Good food and service...and plenty aloha!  I would definitely come back, and hopefully none of those "hangry" Yelpers are around!  LOL!

First time to CPK in Kailua, and maybe the last! Ordered artichoke dip and the chips were stale. My 1yr old son was served a bowl of fruits that looked like they were initially cut up for a cocktail drink probably had been sitting out for awhile because they were starting to turn brown. Also waited 30mins to order, and no they were not busy. Only had 4 other tables occupied, 2 of which had already been served.  As for our waiter Tina she was very pleasant and I didnt mind leaving her a tip because our drinks were never empty and our food came out in a timely manner. Heard so many good things about this place and wanted to experience what all the hype was about,  left feeling let down.

I didn't feel like driving to Ala Moana to eat at CPK so we settled for the Kailua CPK.  Bad idea.  The food stilllll sucks at the Kailua CPK.  The avocado rolls were not filled and seemed extra oily.   The servings of pasta were way less than the CPK at Ala Moana and did not taste as good too.  The servings were so small, we were able to finish our meals.  At the Ala Moana CPK, we always have leftovers to bring home and leave happy.  So diappointed for a pricey dinner.

Let Me start off by saying, that up until today, I VOUCHED for CPK in Kailua. My other half and I would eat here every friday(literally) and they never disappointed. We got there a little before 7am, and asked for a booth. We always expect a 45-1 hour wait because like I said we go there a lot. After not going to this location due to us moving farther away, we were in the area and decided to eat dinner there!(yay)..not. the hostess, who was a young girl let us know that there is a booth who have their food boxed up and that it would be about 15-20 minutes. So we said GREAT!(We thought, wow, perfect timing) My other half and I get talking and notice that HOLY CRAP, it's 8 o'clock!  I send my other half to ask the hostess what's going on, and if they're not going to leave, if she can seat us else where already. He came back, and said "we got interrupted by the general manager(peter), but she basically said they have they're check but are taking longer to leave. I wait another 5 minutes(pissed at this point, which is the only reason I sent my other half to talk to her). At this point, we are investigating the 3 booths they have and notice that the table she pointed out that was supposed to be for us, has a different family seated!!!! So not only did we wait for nothing, she lied about when I asked her. Then I told her to seat us elsewhere, and she said, it's still going go be a wait for another table. (W.T.F) her attitude sucked. So, after a terrible experience trying to get seated, we sit at the table that these 2 girls had come in after, and had already finished eating at. We decide the food is always great here and we would give them benefit of the doubt. We get greeted by a waitress and she comes out with the most stale pieces of bread, that it was crumbling at the touch. We order the avocado egg rolls and they were LITERALLY half filled, and soggy on the bottom. We then ordered a chicken picatta(noodles were overdone) and I got a thin crust roasted garlic and chicken pizza(just letting you know they charge an extra 1.50 for thin crust and DON'T tell you). So when getting my pizza, I pick up a piece and the bottom of the pizza is not crispy AT ALL, and just falls.  I decide that's it. I dealt with the bad customer service, I dealt with the bad bread and appetizer, I am NOT eating this pizza that already overpriced and it sucks. Especially when I'm paying more for thing crispy pizza and it's soggy. I ask for the manager and it ends up being a man named peter whom I watched as he approached two ladies sitting next to us, asking them their name and from my perspective, he was a little more interested in their attention, instead of anything else. So upon getting him as the manager, I was disappointed. He gave us the normal "manager" things to say, and took care of our bill. He was "nice", but I'm a manager, and I know what the bullshit things to say are, and he definitely milked it on that. I miss the old crew who were always nice. Especially Hannah. Long story short. Never Coming to This Location Ever Again!

We go to Kailua a lot to visit a bubble tea joint  but every time we pass by CPK, my mind brings me back to our terrible experience here. We literally left the place with two hungry grouchy kids at 9:pm and a hangry husband who pledges to never come back. The waiter brought out bread, took our order. We ate the bread, drank some water and waited...30 minutes later... waited... 45 minutes later... the waiter comes out and tells us that it's the pasta guy, he's behind on his pasta! No apologies, just that it was the pasta guys fault. For all we know, he could've forgotten to put in our order, but then there was hardly any communication so we'll never really know what actually happened. Finally an hour went by and we got up and left unnoticed.

How many chances should you give a restaurant? This was our fourth awful visit in a row at the Kailua CPK location. It used to be really great here and always worth the wait to be seated. Now, once you get seated, the wait to get service and then food takes FOREVER. And never an apology.  When we got our water, one of the straws was dirty and the server commented about how some kind of syrup must have gotten on it. And then left it.  The manager came to tell us that there was a problem with the pizza we ordered and it would take a while longer than the other dishes. So we ordered soup and salad instead. That still took 10 minutes longer than the rest.  We asked to taste a couple wines and the samples arrived a minute before the dinners. Our bread arrived maybe 10 minutes before that. The smell of poop ... we're guessing that was the smell since there were a couple chickens hanging around - did not help the experience.

I'm not the kind of person to write a bad review. I have worked in the food industry before so I know how hard servers and kitchens are working to deliver good food each night. I also know bad service and a bad restaurant when I see it. I want to share my experience with customers so they can have a full view of this restaurant before they decide to dine there.   - My party and I got there around 4:30 pm on a Saturday. Although the restaurant was not full with customers it took a while for our server to even greet us and even longer to get water after we were seated. - When taking our order our server abruptly joked about ordering shots (I'm fine with shots and drinking he was just a little too enthusiastic about us ordering some - shots are mentioned later which made this comment seem strange in retrospect). - We waited for a while for our food to arrive (spinach & artichoke dip + BBQ chicken salad) and a party was seated next to us. Their server joked about ordering a round of shots. It was a family with grandparents, parents, and 2 children. The grandmother said she was allergic to alcohol and she wanted a mango lemonade. The server said she was allergic too and breaks out in hives but she still chooses to drink alcohol. - Our food arrived and the chips were stale and the chicken in the salad had a strange consistency like it was under cooked.  We didn't take home any leftovers. The food was gross.  - During our meal I saw a server walk to the drink station to get a drink which the other servers were doing (the others were totally normal - getting a glass, filling the glass with ice using a scoop, and pouring water for themselves) but this server took a glass and scooped ice into the cup from the ice station directly with the glass! This is a huge no-no - you're supposed to use a scooper to avoid your hands getting all in the ice and for safety reasons (if that glass chips, the entire ice load is ruined and people could drink ice).   I was so glad when the meal was done.

The waiters/waitresses are always great but my dishes are always dirty. Every time I go in there's old food on my plate or something floating in my tea/water cup. Last time we got an appetizer, salad, and an entree and each plate/ bowl had crusty leftovers on it. It's really disappointing because I can't remember a time that I went in and had a clean plate. The food is just alright. (I gave this place two stars and not one because the staff is really friendly)

I have walked and drove by this restaurant too many times to count, after all I've been to a CPK and what else is there to know. This location is in my own city and happens to have a lot of tourists. I try to avoid the tourist locations, but something about the design of the restaurant drew me in. They seated me on the lanai or patio as non - locals would call it. It had a beautiful view of a fountain.  Of course, it wouldn't be Hawaii without a chicken wandering around looking for scraps. The service was very prompt and polite. The food was exactly how CPK should serve their food... hot and tasty.  I think what impressed me most about this CPK was the lanai and it's view.  I think today was just a day to remember.  Remember, it isn't always just the food, it's the views and even the chickens.

I truly enjoyed the covered outdoor area for eating this past time I visited CPK Kailua.  that made it wonderful for the fact that the weather was beautiful and the whole evening could not have been more enjoyable with friends with the gentle winds blowing.  The weather was perfect!  The seats were just in that perfect spot too.  It just made the whole evening perfect. Food wise- yes CPK when it first came to the islands was a wonderful treat of Asian/ Italian Fusion dishes that melted in the taste buds. Now I have a go to meal in mind for good old comfort food.  So it is more staple and less Romantic treat as it used to be. Service was wonderful the past night we went- I think the servers too felt the beautiful weather and even though they were at work fully enjoyed the life living in Hawaii Nei! I guess being not as busy as the Kahala location helps make the food come out quicker and the service to be just a tab better but still a wonderful experience for dining out in beautiful HI.

Got to participate on a field trip excursion with some friends over here today. Kids were given a tour of the inside of CPK's kitchen led by their very own Mr. Magic. Each kid also got to make their very own personal pizza - decorate it with the sauce, cheese and topping choices of olives, pepperoni, and pineapples. As kids were guided to the back kitchen, they were amazed and wowed by watching their lil pizzas get to go in the oven!  Staff were extremely pleasant, and courteous! Nothing but smiles on their faces as they watched my kids go bonkers. Mr. Magic was wowing kids with some magic tricks up his sleeves! My one Keiki ended up melting down as she did not get the opportunity to do one particular trick the other kids did. We were able to get a one on one demo of his trick once he saw the tears. And to make her smile and giggles come back he gave her a special biting a coin in half trick! Not gonna lie even I was impressed watching him go at it! All tears quickly vaporized and my little ones eyes became very big as she was amazed at watching him eat a coin, then witness it being put back together! My girls LOVED their pizzas, and I have to admit - they looked extremely tasty! I was allowed a sample bite of their crust in exchange for a taste of my lettuce! (I ordered the shrimp and chicken lettuce wrap.) The gal who put my order ready out some extra lettuce pieces in for me, and I am extremely grateful. If you order the lettuce wraps - you can not go wrong! Quite filling and even though it's listed as an appetizer, boy does the portion end up being an entree! Thank you so very much CPK for this wonderful treat to my kids today! Loved it! I'll be here to eat for sure another time! :)

Giving 3 stars because some days are good and other days I dead that I chose this place to eat. Some servers are excellent and always check on my party and fills up our drinks. Others times when it's a party of 2, some waiters don't care as much because our bill won't be as high as other party with 5 people. Another this is that sometimes the food wasn't worth the wait. A couple days ago the server said the bread is still being baked. 20 mins later the bread we got was cold/ room temp and tasted stale. We keep coming back because of the convenience and occasional good service.

We've been coming to this CPK location for years. Not sure what happened but the service and food quality has gone down significantly. With not many options in Kailua it's frustrating. Order get mixed up or the food comes cold and late. I hope things can get corrected.
It is what it is. Just like any other CPK on the mainland. My main complaint whenever I go is slow service.

Went there for lunch on 6/17/17   Had the worst service ever by Dieron!! We ordered a salad and spring rolls to share we never got share plates to eat on .We're sitting there like is she going to bring us some plate to eat on??? We'll she never came back so we had to ask another server for plates.Every time we needed something we had to try to flag er down!!!...She was serving other tables around us but we weren't getting that same kind of service. She brought share plates to her other tables .She refilled drinks to her other tables .We had to flag her down to refill our drinks.She cleared dishes from her other tables .We had to pile ours in the middle of our table to make room for our desserts. Its very irritating to have to flag down a server everytime you need something.Very disappointed in Dieron service today.....
Two hours.  I order pizza and it takes 2 hours?  Thats completely unsatisfactory. Whats the point?  You guys suck.

Great Service.  Had the waitress pair a wine of my choice first, then any food.  She chose a pizza, cheese.  There was other stuff but any wine connoisseur would know, cheese and wine go great together.  Free bread, with oil of course.  Balsamic vinegar, of the same blend, and yes, it would have been a Michelin star.  That's all. Tip for the winemaker of the blend, I forgot which one I ordered(that's how good the meal was), dry as f. Every girl knows, I'm a guy weird but I know this stuff, blends should always be sweet.  Tip from maragaritaville.   Flour recipe must be a California recipe, the wheat has too much of the wrong stuff.  Better to use just phosphorus and potassium in equal amounts, nitrogen can be synthesized easily, plant lead structure is everything you need to know about what a plant's job is. Make food. Even poison is a flavor, everyone knows that. That's why we bred Nightshades, better known as tomatoes and eggplants as well as chili peppers to all be used for food. I'm assuming this is a worldwide thing that happened just before the Middle Ages, when people will still smart enough to build aqueducts above the ground and it underneath.  Anyway, great food, pairing was perfect, I forgot the name of the waitress, but I was the guy that sat alone, and outside.  Great pairing. Malbec or a red blend(made by the bartender, its just house wine after all that is supposed to be mixed to taste, or perfect)

Bottom line: CPK, but with consistently slow service.  The food at this location is a little inconsistent at times. Sometimes good and other times makes you wonder if they're training a new chef... ...maybe that's why they're so slow here all the time. The last few visits here have had us waiting for food for over 45 minutes past our order time.  In any case, this place is dropping in ranking on our list of regular place to go.

Lots of tables but had to wait 30 min then seemed like forever for the food and when leaving two hostess in the front kept talking without saying thank you or goodbye as we left will not be back to this cpk location sad to say.

It's my first time at the Kailua location. I burned my throat eating the bread with olive oil, I found out the hard way that  it has chili pepper seeds hidden in the herbs and pepper flakes. A seed went slowly down my throat and burned my throat.  Who knew it had chili pepper seeds? When I mentioned it to one of the staff she said the oil has pepper flakes.  I replied that no one told me about the small chili pepper seeds hidden in the herbs and olive oil.  I pointed out the seeds in the little white dish.  I had to request butter to put on another small piece of bread to coat my throat since the water I drank just made the burning down my throat worse.  I ordered the watermelon strawberry salad with chicken. Don't order the chicken.  It was so salty that I couldn't swallow the chicken.   I had them remove the chicken and just ate the salad. They left the piece of chewed chicken on the plate when it was brought back to the table. They didn't even offer to put another piece of chicken so I guess their chicken is always made too salty. I had to ask that the extra price of the chicken be removed from my bill since I had it removed and the waitress didn't indicate the additional cost would be taken off.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the food and the response received.  Could the bad chicken be in response to me originally returning the salad because I ordered the salad with dressing on the side and it came out with the dressing already mixed in? Go to another location.

I absolutely love CPK and am always a happy camper with leaving this establishment but today was such a horrible experience. The only reason I gave it three stars was because the food was good! The service I experienced today was absolutely horrible. I was going to give my server Jared the benefit of the doubt since it was slightly busy when we first came in but even after it started to slow down the service didn't improve. No plates were given when at the beginning of the order I mentioned we'd be sharing an app, pizza, and salad. We weren't checked on until the end of the meal. The salad was brought to us incorrectly and I had to mention that the avo was missing. Drinks weren't refilled when both of them were empty. And when we asked for our tab it took him ten minutes to hand us our bill. I work in the service industry myself so for me to even write a yelp review (which all industry ppl hate) it definitely means that this was a bad experience! Jared- pls work on your multitasking & customer service. I won't be coming back to this location for a while and if I do I'll sit at the bar with Kapena whose always awesome and on it!

If you knew me, my friends and family you would know we love CPK. This evening I ordered curbside service given a pick up time of 7:00. I arrived promptly at 7:00 called CPK and was transferred to the correct desk. I waited on hold for 14 minutes before I packed up my child with his wheelchair and headed into CPK. There I waited another 4 minutes before I stopped a waitress to ask if I could get my order. Only knew how long because I was still on hold waiting for them to answer. My next encounter was with the manager. I expressed my concern about how long I was on hold and waiting. She said that was not possible and quizzed me about how I contacted the location. Still on hold and the light flashing on her phone. Then as she noticed I was displeased with her attitude she offered to deliver it to my car, I was already there so said I'd wait.  They gathered my food and I laid the money on the counter. At this point she comped my food. Kind of apologized. By no means did I want my food for free. The apology was weak but appreciated. If they are unable to handle the curbside service they should just offer to go inside.  This is the third time I have spent between 30 and 40 minutes trying to get my curbside order.  My hope is that this review will help this struggling location find the help they need to maintain strong customer service. I would like nothing better than to adjust this review and give a great review. The food was really great that's why they got 2 stars!!

Pizza is really good.  Nice crust and light on the sauce.  We weren't sure what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised and would definitely eat here again.  Had a petite wedge salad and the mushroom. peperoni, sausage pizza.  We great to eat in a place that still has fresh brewed iced tea, not that crap from the soda machine.  We were seated quickly, but larger parties had a short wait.

My friend had a coupon for a free appetizer.  We were given a choice of three items.  I picked the garlic spinach flatbread which was deliciously crispy! Our goal was to eat healthy so we both had salad. My friend had the Waldorf which was a bit tart for her.  I had the BBQ chicken which I never tire of because of the crisp toppings the sparse cheese and the usual BBQ sauce. Variety is the spice of life,  eh? We celebrated my birthday and they gave us a free dessert without asking for my I.D. We had the salted caramel pudding which goes down smoothly even after drinking an entire peach iced tea, ate a full sized salad,  and had 3/4 of the flatbread! The tall make server brought it to us instead of our original server. .. after he sang "Happy birthday", We could see why he was chosen. ..for his clear, resonating and VERY audible voice! EVERYONE turned and looked!  They must've been looking at the lighted candle on my dessert. ..I ate the whole thing! !  Everything was so good and the company & surroundings were so pleasant that I forgot to take photos!  Had a wonderful experience!

Went for dinner with family of four and were told wait was 30-45 mins. Got buzzed in 25 mins and went to hostess table when a new patron comes up to hostess who was about to sit us and demands who was manager on duty. She told him "remy" and he walks ahead of us to service area while we were being seated. I watched the interaction with interest as they spoke, remy went to a computer, entered some info and then brought him and his party to a table close to us right away even though the wait outside continued. I know this happens in this business but it aggravated me to see it so obvious without any descretion or regard to the many others waiting outside. Food was good,kitchen was slow due to rush but service was great. Hawaii does not have many good pizza joints so a reliable pie was wanted and the salads were the best. Just clean up public skills!

Dined here on 9/4/16 for dinner. *** told we had to wait 30 minutes and would have to wait another 30 minutes for our food once seated.  Ok. It's worth it right? ** ordered shrimp scampi which can't go wrong.  Sorry to say it was the worse I ever had. No butter, seemed soupy with a brownish color. Tasted like bitter parmesan and zukes. Added salt and still no taste.  Paid extra for mushrooms and got a few tiny bits of stems. My friend had a lot in her dish but hey, I was treating.  **ordered a pizza to go from the start. At the end of the meal I reminded the waitress.  Answer..oh I forgot to put in the order.  How long will it be? 10-15 min. Surprise.. got home and gave it to my son. He said , it tasted bad.  Pizza was half done. Scallions raw and crunchy, pineapple still Juicy straight from the can and hardly any tomato sauce or cheese. It's still sitting in the fridge.  Tipped over 20%. If I knew the pizza was rare I think I wouldn't have Tipped so much. Left feeling ripped off. Will never go back there again and will hesitate going to any cpk.

Trying take out for the first time, here... I was told to pick up at 7:09pm. I arrived at 7:13pm. It is now 7:48pm and my order is still not ready.......Yikes!  I do not recommend trying their take out if you are hungry and in a hurry....

I ate at this CPK located in Kailua town shortly after dining at a restaurant that was sorely lacking organization. I sat facing the kitchen and marveled at the efficiency CPK must pride itself in. Seriously, I've never gotten an order wrong and my food is always delivered in such a timely manner.  This particular Kailua location shares a parking lot with Longs and Macy's. There is ample parking in the brightly lit parking structure and there are some neat shops on the walk to the restaurant. This location is tiny compared to the Ala Moana and Kahala locations; in addition, it is super popular among the residents of Kailua, so be prepared to wait. They do have bar seating that is usually available, in addition to the normal table seating (both indoor and outdoor). The also have a take out side (and little waiting area) on the street side of the restaurant. Because it is so tiny and popular though, it tends to get loud.  You can always count on CPK for consistent food options. My favorites include the BBQ chicken salad, the waldorf chicken salad, the grilled vegetable sandwich with caesar salad  and the kung pao spaghetti. Drink wise, I like their flavored teas and lemonades (with free refills!!) and their white sangria and mojitos.  The service here is typical of other CPKs I have been to, which is a good thing--the waiters are experienced and friendly and really create an experience that you want to return to. CPK also has a little rewards program that conveniently sums up your points on their mobile app. It's not very rewarding, but it's kinda fun to receive $5 off or a free dessert every other time I go.  The only downside to this restaurant is the size. I really wish they would expand!!
I love this place cause so many people don't finish their food and you can cruise around and eat left-overs from various tables after guest leave- free of charge! Real bang for ur buck if u ask me!!

I have been going here for years and now I can say that I'm pretty much done. I love the quinoa arugula salad and always ask for it without the feta cheese and again it showed up with feta in it. I didn't send it back since that would take forever (I did it before when they didn't put the dressing on the side and they put so much that it makes it soggy). I picked out what I could and told both managers that came over spontaneously just to see how things were going. We were more upset that the pear Gorgonzola pizza was not on the menu, which is the only thing that my boyfriend goes there for and it's been there for years. There is a new make your own pizza and salad place (Pieology) opening in Kailua that will have more vegan options, so we'll be going there instead.

So I have always had a soft spot for the food at CPK. So this review won't speak to that. This issue is that the service is utterly abysmal. I was quoted a time to pick up food. Here I am, thirty minutes later and no food in sight. This isn't the first time for this either. Should have learned last time.

Concur with some of the other reviews here.  The food is usually good.  I also have had some decent curbside service in the last.  That being said, it seems that this service has took a nose dive in recent years.  I called the number for curbside pick up and had to be transferred twice to the correct person.  I scheduled a pick up for 4:00pm and it is now 4:15 and still waiting.  There are a lot of people here also waiting.  This service is not recommended.

We ordered our food from the CPK before coming to CPK so we could get curbside pickup service. Unfortunately we waited for over 10 minutes and after endless ringing and multiple unanswered calls we were forced to go inside. What's the point of curbside service if you're not going to answer the phone and force customers to go inside to pickup their food? This completely defeats the purpose of CURBSIDE pickup.  The staff inside were completely useless and when we tried to explain the situation and ask why they weren't picking up the phones we were told that the phones were working fine for everyone else and that they would speak to a manager, which did nothing to help our situation.

CPK Kailua was terrible. We had the worst waiter that had such a bad attitude and such bad food. He even had someone else clean our table and bring us our checks because he did not want to come back and talk to us while he was behind the bar talking to his coworkers. On top of that, our food took almost 30 minutes, all the while our waiter never put in our appetizer order and we never got it. We couldn't even ask him if it was coming because he would not make eye contact and would not ask us if we needed something else. We then saw our food sit under the heat lamps and on the counter to be served for a long period of time before they actually were brought to our table. When our food finally arrived, none of the dressing came with the salad, I had to ask for it, and the food that was supposed to be hot was cold. My boyfriends sandwich was hard and he didn't finish it, which is a first. I would understand if it was busy, but it was midday, only a few tables, and lots of staff just talking. I've always had great experience at CPKs, but this was by far the worst. I will not be back to this location, but maybe another.

Met some friends for lunch on Saturday (11/12/16). Service was really off. It was as though the servers were very distracted or in a zombie haze. They took orders for drinks and brought one and then disappeared for ages and would come back and bring out another one (one at a time). We had appetizers and bread and they brought no plates. We had to ask for plates. They brought 4 plates, though there were 6 of us. We had to ask them to bring 2 more plates. We asked for balsamic vinegar... that didn't come till the bread was almost gone. Food was great, but I don't know what the deal with the servers were. One server spilled ice and water all over the floor as she was pouring water for another table. They just stared at her kinda shocked, she didn't even apologize or acknowledge. The restaurant was not crowded. It was really weird.

Usually good, but waited over 45 minutes and the server hadn't even put the order in. If it was packed, it would've been okay, but it was not too crowded. Seems to be slowly going downhill. Manager offered a free plate. With 3 kids there, was hoping to get their mac and cheese. Oh well, rather support local than the mainland franchises from n

Love the Kailua location. You can either choose to sit outdoors or eat indoors. Food is always consistent and tasty. I love ordering the chicken piccata or sometimes I order it with Salmon. The bbq chicken salad is really good as well as appetizers, you can't go wrong with avocado club rolls or spinach artichoke dip. Today I ordered the chicken piccata and my noodles were super mushy which was unusual since they're usually consistent...but it took them three tries to get the noodles to the right texture. We also got five dollars off when using our dough rewards. You get five dollars off for every hundred dollars you spend at CPK!

Awesome food it just takes forever for to come out. Super small and crowded with bigger servers barley squeezing through. The service is absolutely terrible. Went from one of my favorite places to the very bottom. Very inconsistent and unorganized establishment

I came here with my sister and a friend after a hike and beach morning. BIG shout out to Mike! He was simply a joy to have as a server, always checking on us, gave us to go cups for the DELICIOUS lemonade, would joke around with us and he made suggestions that we then chose! Started with some fresh from the oven bread with olive oil and herbs, which I would say the only downfall was we each got one 1" slice of their bread. We wanted more, but my scale thanks you. My friend ordered the Hawaiian Pizza (this girls diet consists of pizza, wings, and bacon) and she loved it and didn't realize how hungry she was until she finished all but one slice. My sister had a bbq sandwich and a ceaser side and I had the California club with caeser salad on the side. Both were yummy these sandwiches were bigger than we thought and both ended up taking home the other half. But in all honesty, I saved my other half for lunch tomorrow so I could get dessert.  Mike suggested the Belgian Chocolate Souffle with ice cream, I ordered and we all ate it!  I never saw the bottom of my lemonade and I would have to say I had about 5 glasses, yay sugar! lol  Best CPK on island as far as service in my opinion. I've had some extremely slow service at others.

I have only eaten at this location 3 times and each time I come, it is always crazy busy! On my last visit, my daughter and I were shopping around Kailua and CPK sounded so good after working up an appetite. We got there at about 6:15 pm and we were shocked to see groups of people already waiting outside and the restaurant was packed. When we walked up to the hostess bar, the manager said that if we wanted to be seated right away, we were more than welcome to sit at the bar. Of course we jumped at the chance since we were famished! The bartender was very attentive, kept our drinks filled and always checked up on us. Even though the restaurant was quite busy, we didn't really feel the hustle and chaos since we were out of the main dining area. I don't think I need to elaborate on the food, since everyone is pretty familiar with the menu *LOL*. Overall, food came out quickly, drinks were always filled, and the staff is pleasant. We definitely enjoyed our meal and will be back the next time we shop around Kailua!

I've eaten here many of times and service and the food was always great. I went here recently with my girlfriend before she left on her trip we ordered the spinach artichoke dip which is always a great choice and we also ordered the jambalaya fettuccine and the bbq pork sandwich. our server was great it was just that our food was served cold and our appetizer came out with our entree so we ended up not eating the appetizer at all. as well as our strawberry lemonade had no flavor what so ever.

My family regularly dines at our neighborhood CPK Kailua Hawaii and we return because we are almost always satisfied with the food and the service. However, today we picked up our takeout order and we were COMPLETELY DISAPPOINTED. We travel a lot and something that gives us comfort is knowing that the CPK on the mainland will be consistent with the taste and service of our hometown and go-to restaurant here in Kailua. Sometimes with orders there are slight mistakes but today almost everything in our order DID NOT MEET OUR EXPECTATIONS. First of all, it took over an hour for the order to be completed, which is unacceptable.  Secondly, when my husband Corey picked up our order, the person handed him our drinks in a huge bag without a drink carrier. The lemonade and apple juice fell over, spilled and the bottom of the paper bag got wet and he had to take it upon himself to ask for a drink carrier. Unfortunately 1/3 of our kid's lemonade was already gone and there was no offer to fill it up. The bag was wet, falling apart, and the items almost fell out of the bag by the time he got home.  When we opened up the FUSILLI ALFREDO, it looked different from what my daughter was used to. This is basically all she eats from CPK so she definitely knows what its supposed to look and taste like. Sure enough, it was WATERY AND WITHOUT TASTE. We tried adding some salt to it, but nonetheless, after one bite, we couldn't stomach any more. It was a waste. Both the BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA AND THE WORKS PIZZA was disappointing as well. The crust on both were SOGGY and the ingredients were not at the high standard we are used to from CPK Kailua. It almost tasted OLD, like eating re-heated leftovers. Lastly, the 4 ice cream sundaes barely had any ice cream in the cups. Most of the cup was filled with whipped cream and we were surprised and disappointed yet again.   We tossed everything but the spaghetti with meat sauce and wedge salad.  We have never had an order like this so we decided as a family to let you know as a courtesy in order to help your future guests. Because of this experience, we are considering opting for other restaurants in the area instead of our go-to CPK. Sincerely, Kawehi, Corey and Anela

Lauren the hostess, and Mike was ultimately the best staff I have ever met eating at any CPK location. I guess the dinner crew compared to the lunch crew is just galaxies apart. Both of them were super pleasant and very gracious more than any person I have been served by. Maybe the lunch crew should observe how the late staff does. I have had decent customer service at lunch but after a long day and being greeted by these two makes eating here worthwhile and puts an exclamation on my day. GREAT JOB MIKE AND LAUREN!!!!

Ate at this location for the 1st time today. My friend and i came here for lunch today after hiking the lanikai pillboxes (which was so pretty!) and were seated pretty quickly. Our food took a little bit longer than expected but was still yummy, i didnt like that they brought my soup and my pasta out at the same time though. Also- we waited quite a while, and asked two different waitresses to box out leftovers for us.. we waited 10 minutes until the manager came over asking if everything was okay, and offered to box our food up for us. We got our food and check and dashed. Not the best cpk visit ive ever had
Not happy, standing at takeout and NO one says anything to me, like wasn't even there...so I left and went to Pearl Ridge.

California pizza kitchen has always been a go to place. You have a vast array of food you can choose from. From their healthy large bowls of salad, to the avacado club roll to the pasta, pizza Mac n cheese but the dessert is where it's at. The cream of the corn would be their famous butter cake with Hagen daz vanilla ice cream. Place can be s bit pricey if you order an app, salad pasta or pizza but it's worth it! Always a great staff. Waiters and hosts always got their game faces on. The pizzas are frying in those signature style brick oven a wide variety of adult beverages to drink, mix, experience it's definitely a way to go with this place.

Forewarned is Forearmed We've been visiting this Kailua CPK since it first opened and this is my first review of this store.  First the positives- deliciously consistent and tasty food; attentive and friendly bar, counter and waiters and waitresses. Because we really enjoy their food, and I like cold Newcastle beer in a frosted glass, we've designed a few strategies for eating at this CPK: 1) If ordering for pickup, plan to arrive later than you've been told to arrive. You should also ask if they are running a school special that evening.  Or, just arrive when they say to arrive, but plan to have a cold beer at the bar while watching some sports.  The bartenders (JJ in particular) are excellent and the beers are always served in a frozen glass.  2) Be sure to go through your entire order piece by piece to make sure you are getting what you ordered. (We actually write it down before calling it in and use that as a checklist) Sometimes they are a little skimpy on the salads and pastas when you order to go...but when it is pointed out they will make it right. Don't forget to ask for bread and their tasty, herbed olive oil. 3) When you are dining in, be prepared to take an active role in getting your food on time. If you are pressed for time, order everything quickly and ask for updates. Often they are working too many tables and they are not pros, so checking in seems to help. Or, just be prepared to take your time and enjoy yourself. Forewarned. Once we implemented these strategies, we really began to enjoy our Kailua CPK experiences. Everyone seems to be trying their best and the food is delicious. It's just a busy store and it helps to plan ahead and to set your expectations properly.

This was the worst CPK experience I've had at any mainland CPK and even Seoul CPK.  The hostess, Sunshine, was super rude when we checked in. She told us it'd be 20 minutes for us to sit but the restaurant had many many open tables. After waiting for 10 minutes, we asked her for an update and also inquired as to why we were waiting when so many tables were open (was it because there were tons of reservations?), she didn't give us an explanation but snapped at us, saying "I said it'd be 20 minutes. It's 20 minutes." We were super taken aback by this kind of behavior. She was cold and unconcerned. When prompted again and when we asked to speak to her manager, she said that the manager was holding on seating because the kitchen was overwhelmed. She could have kindly and gently explained the situation to us but her rude and uncaring demeanor is inexcusable.  After being seated, we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, a glass of Pinot Noir, roasted veggie salad with salmon and a chicken BBQ pizza. The chips that came with the dip were SO stale, the wine was corked (we had to ask for a different glass), and the salmon was insanely overlooked and hard (after specific prior request to ensure salmon wasn't overdone).  Worst. CPK. Ever. Idk who is in charge of this place , but their operations are horrible. The manager was also barely concerned at the lack of service and awful food. We will never be returning and warning our friends to stay far away from this place.

Experienced amazing service here from the manager Remy, she was always willing to pitch in to assist all the wait help and made us want to go back soon. She was friendly, helpful and made our dining experience great. She is a great example of how all employees should be. Will definitely be back because of her.

CPK Kailua was the go to family dinner restaurant up until recently. We have noticed that the service and food quality/taste has been on the decline. On our most recent visit, the server appeared to be in a bad mood, only partial of our food came out after a long wait, a member of our party ordered the Halibut which turned out to be a disappointment. Not only was it served when the rest of the party was nearly done with dinner, it smelled so bad that we had to return it immediately. Had to ask the manager to remove the inedible dish from our check as our removal request had to be approved?! Very disappointing we won't be returning.

Something's just amiss at this location and it's a real bummer!  Every time we've tried it in the past, it's a disappointment.  This time no exception; from being told we couldn't sit in a booth because he was "saving it for a party of four" and then in the next 25 minutes he sat two parties of two in two of the open booths; to waiting at least 30 minutes for our bread; to finally receiving our order which had an ingredient in it that was requested when ordering, to be excluded....just a bummer!    Also have read other reviews that hit it on the nail; maybe it's just too small for all of the running around that the servers seem to have to do.  They all seem to be hustling but things get missed due to being perhaps given too many stations for one person?  I don't know but it's just not working.....and lots of inconsistencies.  Please CPK, fix it; we love you but this location's just not flowing right.

CPK Kailua...What is up with the poor service here? Unacceptable. Created an account just so I could review this place. Had I known there were so many bad reviews of this branch I would have never came here. Pay close attention to the 1 and 2 star reviews before you come here.  Ordered food at 8:00 with a requested pickup time at 9:00. I arrived at 9:05 and was told by the hostess that my order was not ready yet. I looked around and there were only 3 tables being waited on so I said whatever and just took a seat. 15 minutes later and the hostess is stuffing my order in big brown bag and practically shoving it in my face without saying a word to me. I thought, gee thanks! No sorry or anything for making me wait. Took food and left. My friend ordered the Roasted Veggie salad and when we got home we discovered that her salad consisted only of lettuce, cheese and avocado. Unacceptable. She called CPK Kailua and they confirmed they had given her the wrong salad and to come back. When I got back to CPK I saw the same hostess (tall African American woman behind the cash register) and I simply said that she gave me the wrong salad. She became extremely defensive with me saying "No I didn't, No I didn't. You're just missing the toppings." She preceded to the back and retrieved a tiny container with the missing veggies and practically flung it at me. Again, no apologies or compensation of any kind for making me drive all the way back to CPK to receive the rest of my order. I'll admit that at this point I was a little upset, but instead of making a scene I simply took my food and left. As I was walking to my car, a hostess followed me out of the restaurant and in a real condescending tone she said "Byeeeeee Tim Evans!" I was absolutely shocked. Real professional CPK, real professional. I have never experienced such poor service in my whole life. California Pizza Kitchen I hope you are reading this because you just lost 2 customers for life. Thanks for nothing.

Never returning to this location. Waited 20 mins to just place our order. Waitress kept walking past us, making eye contact. Walked out after the 20 mins, didn't order at all. Not even worth talking to a manager cause we were so irritated. They weren't even that busy when we were seated either! There were about 5 tables still open. Great place to go if you want to just kill 20 mins :) This one bad experience turned me to NEVER wanting to go to this location.

My 6yo niece wanted to go here to celebrate her birthday. We went on a Friday evening around 5:30. Bad choice. The hostess said it's would be about 30-40 minutes. Since my niece chose the place, we decided to wait for a table. 45 minutes went by... then an hour... finally after waiting 1:15, we were seated after my husband went up and stood there giving them stink eye. There had been tables open on the lanai for a while, but no one was being seated!!!  Once seated to service was good. The pizza was super small that I ordered (I think my 13yo could have eaten two of them alone).  My niece got a free scoop of ice cream for her bday, which was nice. So in the end, they get 4 stars for food taste, 3 for portion, 1star for wait time, and 4 for the server.

I do have to say, I have been to this restaurant quite a few times and never quite had the service that I was hoping for. But tonight was different, Tina was an absolutely amazing server! She will be the reason I will be returning.

We came here to have lunch with a couple friends of ours. This is my first time at this location and my wife warned me ahead of time that it does get pretty loud but the sound of the lime agave margarita made me not give a rip.  The mojito and lime agave margarita was a perfect starter before we ordered some appetizers. Lettuce ( I prefere the romain lettuce instead if the iceberg stuff) wrapps with chicken filling and the nachos with artichoke and avocado dip were really good but the sesame ginger chicken dumplings were cold like it was premade and waiting for someone to order it but it was good. I prefer it hot though.  The soy ginger chili sauce saved this dish. Our meals followed with the California club sandwich, bbq chicken salad, shrimp fettuccine, chinese chicken salad and I had the habanero carnitas pizza. Koa our waiter reminded me to order the thin crust pizza next time if I don't like the crust because theres more pizza. I kept tearing off the crust from the hand tossed. While eating the pizza, I was thinking, this pizza is not as hot as I thought it would be. Only when we were done our friend tasted what was in a small dish at the far end of the table and started gagging and reached for the water and started guzzling it. Well whatayaknow! I guess we found the salsa for my pizza hahaha! We took home the club sandwich and it is delicious at midnight while writing this review.  We had another round of mojitos and margaritas for desert. Perfect way to end a great lunch with some good friends. Koa did an excellent job of keeping our drinks filled and checking up on us now and then. lots of parking and like my wife warned me in the beginning, yes this place gets really loud.

I love CPK.... so it was a welcomed sight when in Kailua one day for a doctors appointment. With this visit, I've now been to every CPK location on the island. This is in a great location, right next to Macys and has a really nice patio area. I made a mental note that this would be a great setting for hosting a baby shower or small birthday lunch. Our waiter was so friendly and great with my kids. Bummed I forgot to look at his name tag but he gave superb service. The manager on the other had was quite cold and unfriendly. He asked me to move on the side as I was waiting to be seated and just the way he spoke to me wasn't consistent with other CPK manager interactions I've had at Pearlridge, Waikiki, Kahala and Ala Moana where they were super accommodating, friendly, and even make the time to stop by your table to check on your meal (which he did not do). Maybe he was having a bad day. Food was on point as usual with the exception for the pumpkin cheesecake which was a disaster- worst I've ever had!
Food good as always, but had to ask for plates for  the hummus and a spoon and wait wait wait for the check. Not crowded or anything, just absentminded service.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Kailua for lunch, I don't understand why it's down to three stars on the ratings. The staff are always friendly and ensuring you have enough water or fresh bread. The menu changes on a regular basis with some interesting combinations, my current favorite is the Halibut fish dish. It does tend to get busy quickly and is one of the smaller CPK's on the island but I have never had a bad experience in the years I have been visiting the location. Give it a try after 14:00 quietens down a lot around then if crowds are not your thing.

I typically am so pleased with this restaurant.. but last night was so disappointing! The food was everything less than perfect. Everything was over cooked or burnt. And to make matters worse it took forever for our food to come out. Tables that sat after we ordered got their food before us. As a previous server I'm not one to complain but when your appetizer, entree, and soup and burnt there is a problem. Very disappointed with the kitchen. On the other hand our server was amazing! She was very patient, and kind. She was very apologetic with the problems with our food (even though she had nothing to do with it)! She was a wonderful server.  I hope the problems in the kitchen can be fixed so I can come and enjoy here again.

We are usually fairly lucky and do not have to wait. The only thing we have needed to wait for is the food that takes a little while to come out sometimes. The staff is friendly and helpful. There was one hostess who was very enthusiastic. The food tastes like any CPK, so nothing really special if you go to CPKs a lot. The wait can take a while tho sometimes. They also are doing a deal--if you sign up for the CPK dough thing, you can get a free small plate. Overall, it's an okay experience here for us.

CPKs on the island are so different!  This one is a small restaurant, tucked in a corner of a building next to pier one.  Driving by, we almost missed it- but I caught a glimpse of the yellow and black signage- and thought we should drop in for a quick lunch.   Parking here is good, lots of open stalls in the lot in back. We walked in and we were seated immediately.  Now, unlike most CPK restaurants that are large and very busy, this one is small and intimate.  Despite the size of the restaurant, the number of workers were plentiful- which means there really isn't much excuse for slow service.   I ordered a drink as soon as we sat, that drink never came.  The salad I ordered was missing the key ingredient in the BBQ chicken salad...the BBQ sauce.  (I was wondering why the salad was so bland---didn't realize it until I was nearly done eating) We were in a rush for a quick lunch and go, and it served the job, but not one well done.  Maybe another CPK next time!

This place deserves 4 stars! Good food, service, and prices. I typically enjoy supporting small businesses, but we had these gift cards, see and well, you understand...Anyway, we were seated quickly and our order was taken soon after. For a busy afternoon, our order came up fast and there was a much needed break between pupu's and our yummy pizza. We started with a small wedge salad- super tasty and rich with blue cheese. I was dying to try the newer Buffalo Cauliflower- it was incredible! No need the chicken, this was onolicious! Fried cauliflower, with a bit of breading and drenched in bbq sauce and blue cheese dressing. This is my new CPK favorite! The California Club Pizza was also a winner with plenty bacon, avocado, arugala, tomatoes, killer lemon mayo dressing all on a well done, crispy pizza crust. All in all, sneak in when no one is looking and enjoy the fairly healthy offerings guilt free!

Long lines, cramped atmosphere, long wait for food. After a terrible experience with a waitress, the manager comped our meal and we received an apology letter from the regional manager. The apologies are the only reason I'm rating this place a 4. If you really want a good CPK I suggest going to literally any other location anywhere. On or off island

Don't get take out from this location, it would be faster if you went in, sat down, had a few drinks, an appetizer, split two entrees ; than getting take out from here. This cpk has to step up their game. When I called to place my order the girl taking the order said it would be 16 mins. 16 mins seemed a little fast but hey she must know what she's talking about. I even stopped at longs before hand. When I got to cpk three people were in line. The girl at the register seemed flabbergasted maybe it was her first day? I don't know,  anyway it took almost an hour after placing my order to get my food. People taking orders need to manage their time more effectively. Very disappointed in their customer service.

I usually have no problem with CPK, it's my safe place and hands down always a go to but tonight sucked (more especially the service) I asked for Balsamic- never got it. I had to ask for a refill cause the empty glass on the edge of the table meant nothing.  My pasta was way over cooked. Too soft. I almost dare say yuck.  The rib eye was good tho

This was my first time ordering take out from CPK Kailua, When I got home I opened my flatbread box and the flatbread was literally thrown in there. I was so disappointed. It was only $10.00 but still I definitely will not return due to the lack of care.

Got seated immediately, ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and the Club Rolls (I think this is the name..?) as an appetizer. As always I ALWAYS ask for the appetizer out first. We received our pizza in about 20 minutes, ate that, and then the appetizer came out. I reminded the server that I requested the appetizer first, and she claimed she told the kitchen it needed to be  put out first but they didn't. Even if I hadn't, it's unacceptable to have the appetizer AFTER you're done with the main course. She never came by to ask how we were doing, and only came back later to ask if we wanted dessert. This was my first time at a CPK and I won't be back. Pizza was mediocre but the service was very poor. EDIT: the manager of this location reached out to me and handled the issue and apologized. Because of this I will be trying CPK again.

I came here for a late lunch and service was terrible. We were however greeted and seated quickly but once we ordered and our food was delivered, our server did not come back around to check on us or refill our drinks. We ordered the California club pizza, bbq chicken salad and garlic fettuccine pasta with mushrooms and shrimp which was all so tasty and wonderful which is why I am giving 3 stars but the service needs work.

I must say our service tonight was one of the best we have had at CPK. But with the exception of the salads, it was far from good. Our Margarhreta thin crust was so undercooked and poorly topped it had to be eaten with a fork and a knife. We also need to ask for some red sauce as it only had a few smashed tomatoes in the limp crust. Aside from the tomato there was a scant portion of cheese and a sprinkling of basil so small that it could only be detected by sight and not taste.

What a great experience for first time. My server was great a smile that went a mile and a very friendly nature. The food was great I sampled a number of appetizers and loved every one of them. Something that amazed me while I was sitting back and waiting for my meal was a gal named Josie. I guess she was the one that expedited the meals because she was the best I have ever seen in that position. I don't know how she did it, but she went at the speed of light Non-Stop the whole time I was there. The entire experience is worth coming back for. Definitely a 10 experience.

Since I live in Kailua I frequent CPK quite often.  Plenty of parking available, so you never have to worry about that.  The restaurant itself can get very busy especially during weekends.  However wait times are pretty fast, and you can call ahead to put your name on the list.   Usually I don't like to write reviews for franchise restaurants since most people will still eat there despite reviews.  However I'm really disappointed by the staff especially during late night hours before closing.  Staff get rowdy in the kitchen.  A lot of yelling and very distracting when you are trying to eat.  Numerous times pans are falling on the ground creating loud noise.  I'm not sure if manager is on duty around the 9pm times.  But the noise level created by the staff is extremely annoying.  It seems they get wild when the restaurant is about to close.  Whatever the case may be it needs to stop.  Kitchen staff need to get under control.

What's the point of calling in your order if it goes to a mainland call center.  If you show up 5 minutes after the ready time and your order isn't in the system AND you have to wait to re-order your food.  BEYOND FRUSTRATING After all these years you'd thin cpk would have their act together.  So so so sad And the place is only half-full right now because it's off hour (215)pm Really, I expected more from this place AND...all I got was an "I'm sorry"... no discount, no free desert  NOTHING I thought cpk was better at customer service than this

I have come here pretty frequently with my friends, and I love it here. They have quality food, and they always seem to have pretty good service. Today I ordered the California Club Salad and the Garlic Chicken Pizza. I also love the pesto penne pasta here as well! My al time favorite is the butter cake dessert lol. I always order it for my friends whenever I bring them here.

So I got there and they said it was a 15-25 min wait, 55 mins later I get seated. They sat us outside and the tables were dirty and had ants crawling on them.  10 mins later someone finally stops by to take the order and bring us water.  I ordered the tequila chicken fettuccine which tasted good but they should leave the name chicken out of the name sine it arrived at the table with 4 bite size pieces of chicken  in the whole dish. The server just placed the food on the table and left, never asked if I needed anything. The only time after that I saw our server was when I was done and they had the check. All in all worst service I have ever had at CPK.

Food isn't bad, but the place is always packed so sometimes we order curbside pickup. They never give us the correct time. Today we waited in the car an hour past the time they told us to pick up.  I get it, you're a busy restaurant. We don't mind if you tell us our food won't be ready for an hour or so, but don't have us waiting in the car for that long watching  the cars that came after us receive their bags of food first when we only ordered 2 meals.
Even though it's always crowded on the weekends we always get sat right away. Great fast and friendly service both times we came here, at the bar and outside.

This is the go-to spot for my best friends and I. We came here on a Thursday night for a small bite to eat and drinks. I ordered a strawberry lime margarita, easy on the strawberry purée. It was still sweet, but tolerable. So when I ordered the next one, I made sure to ask for just a splash of strawberry puree. The second one was 10x sweeter than the first. And our server, Who was very sweet, told us that the bartender gave her a dirty look when she asked her to go easy on the purée. So I chugged it because no one likes to waste alcohol. Then I ordered crispy Mac and cheese for my son, and was told it was cheesier than the kids menu MAC and cheese. That dish was overlooked and dry and totally inedible. My friend ordered a fettuccine and that was ok. And the avocado egg rolls were overcooked as well. Idk what's going on in the kitchen, but everything was just bad. No effort, no care.  The server did what she could, and its not her fault because she doesn't make the drinks or the food.  Guess my friends and I have to find a new go to spot because I most likely won't return.

I love CPK but this location has HORRIBLE service. Took forever to get our food, plates for our appetizers, refill on our drinks, and our check. Don't know what happened use to be a fan but not anymore.
Reviews are like options some best kept to oneself. Three Stars. Why? * Price * Food quality and quantity  * Parking * Wait Definitely, a hip gathering and good place outside dinner or lunch hours

Most times, CPK is decent. Sadly, I believe they have been going downhill for a while now. (The pizzas have definitely shrank since they first opened). There are two reasons I am not giving them one star at the moment: 1) Their avocado egg rolls are always fabulous 2) The service is good I ordered take out from the Kailua CPK today, and the person I was speaking on the phone with took quite a long time just checking if they had avocado egg rolls available. When I arrived, the waitress that took care of my order was extremely nice and apologetic for making me wait (even though I knew I would have to wait since I was relatively early for a takeout order). My problem arose when I got home and opened my order of avocado egg rolls and the new "small plate" of spicy buffalo cauliflower. I understand that it is a "small plate," but an order of spicy buffalo cauliflower totals to more than $8. With $8, I should be able to get a sufficient amount of crispy, fried cauliflower. I also understand that since I ordered take-out, the sauce will not be covering the cauliflower as it would be if I ordered in-house. Still, I have never seen a sadder looking appetizer. The cauliflower was weepy, there was not nearly enough pieces, and it all looked as if it had been hastily tossed into the takeout container. I will most likely be back because I enjoy their avocado egg rolls, BBQ chicken salad and kids curly mac & cheese. There are many good items on their menu, but the spicy buffalo cauliflower is not one of them (especially for take-out).

----- Ambiance = 3 stars ----- Food = 3 stars -----Service = 1 star ----- ****  Overall  = 2.333 stars  **** (Disclaimer: I rarely take the time to write low-rating reviews but I'm making an exception especially for Kailua CPK) This CPK in Kailua is NO Ala Moana mall CPK (IMHO, it's the most efficient CPK on Oahu and I come to find out later this CPK is also a training center for all CPKs on Oahu). Whenever I'm  shopping at Ala Moana mall or in the vicinity, I've no hesitations eating at the mall's CPK.  However, when it comes to contemplating whether to eat at this Kailua CPK, I often find myself cursing myself for taking a chance at Kailua CPK. I feel like a gambler because the service here is so "dicey" - meaning I'm just "rolling the dice" here. My low rating is based on the number of visits I had at this location = 3 dine-ins and 2 take-outs. You'd think since this is a CPK Express, service would fared better and faster but that's not the case at all.    On my recent dine-in, the hostess walked me to my table (outdoor seating area) and provided   menu. After perusing throught it, I realized it has been at least 20 minutes and the waitress still has yet to acknowledge me nor come by since I got seated. Due to its small section, the only servicing (my) waitress walked passed me twice without batting an eye, a wince nor turned her head beyond her tunnel field of vision. Similar to witnessing zombie walk. It's like she's avoiding any eye contact as she kept repeatedly servicing the other 2 tables.      This was getting annoying as it was late and granted, the restaurant was not busy at 8 in the evening. So I decided to skip dealing with this person/employee. Hence, the bar seating was clear and seemed more inviting since the bartender probably would be more efficient (I'm hoping). She, (the bartender) was a little better than the waitress (I gave up on) so I was able to place my order. Bartender's service was minimally okay, nothing special, pleasant nor friendly. After 20 minutes, the kitchen informed her my lettuce wrap will be up soon. When the plate slid out, one could clearly see it was no shrimp lettuce wrap as I had ordered, it was chicken lettuce wrap. WTH - shrimp and chicken doesn't even sound alike even if you whispered it. The bartender punched in the order on their terminal system and yet, the wrong meat came out. So another 15 minutes went by before I got my correct dinner entree. What a bunch of non-reliable, low-work ethics employees we got here so far.  While enjoying my delicious lettuce wrap, 3 gentlemen arrived and sat down at the bar too. The  guy sitting closest to me apologized in advance if he's going to hit me accidentally when he swung his injured arm in my direction. It was not a problem as I didn't get hit but we ended up "talking story". Once the men put in their orders, the bartender started making their drinks and I noticed her hand was shaking pretty nervously and her facial expression says it all because you could easily tell the men were quite acquainted with her service or rather lack of service. There was no love lost between the bartender and these paddlers. So I asked, in exasperated tone, the one Kailua resident closest to me, "Is the service here always bad"? He responded by throwing up his hands and replied "Yes, service is bad here". Ugh, I feel it too brother.  In one of my previous take-outs, this CPK was 20 minutes behind in fulfilling my take-out order. I was informed I could sit and wait while they catch up on their food orders.OMG, that is oxymoronic to the entire concept of take-out after the eatery tells you what time their take-out will be ready. Another bad dining episode I experienced at Kailua CPK plays out the same bad slow service tune where I ended up sitting at the bar. Acknowledgement and orders were basically non-existent and nonchalant. Granted, when I choose to dine at a chain-restaurant or eatery, it is for their food and customers do know and expect consistency of quality from the chain whereever the locations maybe.    What is it about the bad servicing issues here in Kailua CPK? Don't get me wrong, I've always loved eating CPK's food and always will. But the one CPK I intend on patronizing as a last resort is CPK in Kailua. Having dined at this Kailua CPK more than a few occasions, I basically have lowered my expectations and try to avoid eating here unless friends  insist on this CPK. An unfriendly staff with a lackadaisical attitude is no place for me nor anyone looking for a decent dining experience. Perhaps it's the isolation of its geography (located on the "other side of the mountain") which might (the only plausible reason I can deduced) explains the core reasons why this Kailua's CPK is consistently bad in the servicing department.

This is for the Kailua CPK. My steak is no where near medium well, in fact I thought I heard it moo! I did complain to corporate but not much was done. With all of the choices in the area I will not be back to this location.  I'm sorry but I have nothing nice to say about this location.

My wife and I came here for dinner on a Saturday night at about 6:00. I think we came between the early crowd and the later crowd as a bunch of people were leaving and a bunch started to arrive after us.  The hostess was very friendly and tried to clear tables so she could sit us right away, but she was continually interrupted by having to return to the front entrance to meet the arriving customers. The tables were eventually cleared and we were seated in just a few minutes.  Our waiter apologized for taking so long to greet us, but we were too busy with the menu to notice. We ordered right away. The bread and olive oil were great. The wedge salad appetizer was also tasty and enough for us to share.  Our food arrived soon after. I had the works pizza and my wife had the rolled pasta with mushrooms. Both were very good.  I think one concern here is that the waiters are really working too hard. They are so busy running around that they do not have the time to be as attentive as they would like to be, although they are trying their best.  I have always had good service here and great meals.  Just have to deal with the crowds as with most popular restaurants.

California Pizza Kitchen is not as consistent as it was before, but it's still one of my favorite places to eat at or get take out from. Their menu has expanded to include a lot of delicious appetizers, salads, pizzas, pastas, and desserts.  My favorite menu items are the white corn guacamole, bbq chicken salad, mushroom pepperoni pizza, and pretty much anything on their dessert menu. My kids love the cheese pizza and crispy chicken from the kid's menu, and the $1 ice cream sundaes are of course A MUST! The CPK app makes ordering take-out orders super easy.  If you haven't already signed up for the CPK Pizza Dough Rewards, you are missing out on discounts and freebies!

Ok kailua does noone notice this nasty feet wet dirty carpet? Omg i came in and i walked out...at first i didnt notice the smell at the door...the guy seating us is an ass. My husband had o e of those knee scooter cause he hurt his leg and the guy just acted like we were walking in w shit all over us or something. Then when we were seated around the middle i started to notice the nasty smell omg we just walked out. The smell is pretty strong. Disgusting.

So today we were offered a table and sat down in a very central area of the restaurant. We sat for 15 minutes literally watching people being seated around us being greeted, served their drinks and bread, as well as making their orders, before we had enough and got up and left. One of the wait staff asked if we've been helped on our way out and seemed shocked we hadn't. Not sure what happened, but it left a pretty bitter taste in our mouths.

Standard. Nothing special stood out about the service except that CPK as a whole company is very accommodating with dietary requests. I was able to substitute zucchini for the fettuccini in my dish. That goes a long way for me. However, I hate when servers fire your dinner order too early and it arrives soon after your appetizers hit the table. It limits space on the table and I get claustrophobic. Usually I don't even order dinner till we have picked at the apps a bit. Not sure why I strayed from that practice on this day but it reminds me of why I do it.

I usually have to wait coming to this location but I came 45 min before closing and they sat me right away. Service was great but the food was ok. We usually get the spinach artichoke dip and BBQ chop salad for appetizers but we decided to try something different. We got the ceaser salad and fried Mac and cheese, the ceaser salad had to much dressing and fried Mac and cheese was dry. I got my favorite pizza the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza and my wife for the spinach artichoke pizza. All in all it was a ok experience, I will be coming back because this is my kids favorite place.

California Pizza Kitchen is pretty consistent with the food selection and quality.   Not sure why tjen this particular branch seems to consistently have smaller portions. At first I thought it was perhaps because today was a special fundraising event for a youth group in the community.  And then I remembered the last two times dining here we were also disappointed in the portion size. Tonite we started with the asparagus arugula salad and I swear the salad was sitting flat on the plate...same width, same length, just completely flat instead of the three dimensional salad we are used to to.  The next appetizer of white corn guacamole and chips came and again it looked like the guacamole was on a very strict diet! So happy the pizzas and entrees are pretty uniform.  The servers are always cheerful and efficient.  Will continue to visit.

My daughter decided to join me on a linner date today (she's 2 so she had no choice) and we chose (I chose) to eat at CPK. We walked in and we were greeted right away with a smile. We had the option of choosing to eat inside or outside and on such a beautiful day here in Kailua, it would've been foolish to choose to eat inside. We were taken outside and greeted by our waitress about 60 seconds after we sat down. Our beverage orders were taken right away and water was brought out as we waited. Once our orders were placed our server, Melissa, offered to bring out my daughters fruit so she had something to snack on to keep her busy! Absolutely appreciated that!!!! I ordered her a Kids cheese pizza and I ordered myself the Carne Asada Pizza. For a cheese pizza that thing was pretty dang good!!! I've been to CPK before but this was my first time just taking a bite of a traditional cheese pizza. It was very flavorful and cooked perfectly!! My daughter loved it! She also enjoyed her side of grapes and pineapple! My Carne Asada Pizza actually blew my mind. The side of salsa verde that came with it impressed me way more than I thought it would. It was nice and spicy which I loved (the waitress did say it varies though so if you order expecting some "fiyah" [my obnoxious way of saying "fire"] it doesn't mean you'll get it). After we enjoyed our pizza our waitress let us know that my daughters meal had a 99 cent sundae so I said to myself, "Might as  well share a dessert with my lovely date!" That was a pretty delectable sundae for being only 99 cents. Overall, my daughter and I had a great server, delicious food, and enjoyed the environment! We'll be back for sure :)

Food was great but the construction noise was crazy and the music was too loud. Our server was friendly but he took a while bringing our check. Overall, not a bad experience but there is opportunity for growth!

Their service standards seem to be slipping over time. I certainly don't expect a "fine dining" experience but I also expect more than a "mom and pop diner"... in fact a mom and pop diner would at least give me a more "homey" welcome feeling.  Food is consistent so no need to really mention it except I tried the new Ban Mi bowl and it left a lot to be desired as far as taste. There was no cilantro and the dressing was gingery but everything lacked overall flavor. Now the service... we were seated right away which was a great start, but that was it.  They really seemed short staffed because the servers were literally and physically all over the place. I counted only 3 of them along with 2-3 bus help. I checked in thru their app so by the time we flagged the manager Peter, more than 15 minutes had gone by. (Maybe if he spent more time managing and observing tables rather than eating lunch and meeting with staff at the VERY NEXT TABLE, he would've noticed us sitting there without being touched). Our server Emily was great, just stretched thin. Food was served on time and she provided as good service as she could under the circumstances. During our lunch, the manager Peter was finishing his lunch meeting along with one of the chefs and another staff member. They were talking pretty loudly and we heard them talking about customer reviews (ironic, I thought lol) and how they could improve...duh, maybe just open your eyes and focus on the people already there.  Hopefully they improve as their staff is doing a good job, they just need better management support and direction in my opinion.

SLOW SERVICE! If you dine here, be prepared to wait even when it's not crowded.  There's a reason why I prefer the California Pizza Kitchen at Ala Moana Shopping Center and the Kahala Mall.  At those locations, they bring the food much quicker than the Kailua location.  We went there today long before the lunch crowd.  There were only two tables inside that had patrons and two tables outside with patrons.  Even with only four tables, they took over 25 minutes for our appetizer! It wasn't like we ordered several appetizers either.  My husband finally had to ask the manager what was going on with the appetizer before we received it.  Honestly this place needs better management. A customer shouldn't have to wait long in an empty restaurant.  The Ala Moana and Kahala locations are far busier and they turn out the food a lot faster.
