The server we had was certainly friendly and enthusiastic, but she didn't come around all that much to check on us.  We could have used more water refills and a refill of the coffee, but we were going to have to send a search party to get someone to do those things.  The food is delicious. The food is consistently good at every CPK location I've been to. But the slow service colored the experience for us.  I doubt I'll dine at this location again though I might use their takeout/curbside service.

Thank you Krysten for making our dinner at CPK wonderful!   I stopped in around 9:30pm with my little one and we were seated, then promptly greeted by our friendly server Krysten and our drink orders were taken right away along with some great recommendations.  There are free refills on the flavored iced teas and strawberry lemonades so if you are really thirsty go for the flavored iced teas, or lemonade!  Since other specialty drinks are not refillable.  Although the fresh strawberry mango cooler is bubbly and really good, I would rather get refillable drinks.  Order the Buffalo cauliflower it's the tenderest most amazing vegetarian substitute to buffalo wings you can get.  The Avocado egg-rolls are really hearty too!  Also, when at CPK remember that the P stands for PIZZA. Because they have the Best pizza!!! Everything about it is so Fresh to def. The crust is soft, ever so lightly sweet and chewy. The marinara game is strong people. I'm sure that there's some legit cooking wine in there with all the mouth watering aromas. Also, their pizzas are obviously in house and made fresh to order. Even their keiki pizza are just as heavenly as the regular sized ones just miniature. My boys got the Hawaiian pizza and the Cheese pizza. My little one ate only half of his and this is a lot of pizza for a 1 year old so as most parents would do I finished his left overs (how could I let it go to waste?)  On my second visit I got the raspberry and mango flavored iced tea and it was the BEST!!!  I have no idea how service could have been better but it did on our second visit with. Our server from our second visit was even more attentive visit who went above and beyond with waters along with our ordered drinks, extra napkins at our request and a free ice cream with a lighted candle for my mom's birthday treat!! Thank you for everything!!!

I'm a fan of CPK but the Kailua location is seriously lacking in several areas, such as cleanliness, friendliness, attentiveness. Better step up your game, cause I won't be back & I can see others feel the same way.  Regardless of Hawaii's laid back vibe, if someone spills salad dressing all over the floor, you clean it up. You don't seat the next party at the table and ignore it! It was all over our shoes and it smelled bad. I cleaned our shoes as best I could & placed several napkins over the spill to contain it. I then explained to the hostess. She seated us elsewhere and I thought she would have the spill and the napkins cleaned up, but NO! She just seated another party at the table.  I asked our waiter for 4 waters (the # of people in our party). He brought two & checked on all other tables before taking our order, even bringing the other parties drink refills first. Unbelievable. We were starving or we would have went anywhere else.  Mahalo, CPK.

My wife has requested that we come to CPK more often based on her BBQ Chicken salad.  The restaurant was laid out nicely.  Smaller than most CPK and had a homey fell.  There are outside and inside seating areas and the host and waitress were very attentive to our need of a group of 5.   The food was solid and they had some good interesting appetizer choices.  We had the buffalo cauliflower and it was a great take on buffalo wings that I want to try at home.  The pizza was good, nothing extremely special but I haven't had a bad pizza going to CPK.  My wife got a whole salad.  It was very large and she only finished about half of it.  The half salads are enough for a lunch meal.  Overall the restaurant was great and the service was great.

NEVER coming back to this location.  If you come here and you get "Tiff" as your waitress, LEAVE!!! Here's the reasons -We waited 40 mins to get seated  -we waited a while to be able to order after being seated  -when we asked for bread she gave us 3 pieces of bread (we are a family of 5)  -Checked on all other tables before us IF she checked on us -she gave me "CHUNKY" strawberry lemonade (the bottom last part of it..gross.  -didn't get the appetizer we ordered. When she brought our main course we asked where is our appetizer she said there was no more of what we ordered..(could have told me sooner so we could've ordered another one)  -when I told her there is no point in getting an appetizer now that we have the main course,  she threw the plate of kids pizza in front of my 2 year old son.  -she was never around for me to ask to bring plates after she brought the main course (the pizza) so we can eat like civilized human beings. The manager was kind when we told him we are walking out of there.

My recommendation to Kailua CPK! get rid of the "call center" for take out orders, first of all the call center sales person told me 16 min to get my order.  I got there about 20 min later and they haven't even started my order, when i finally got my order 45 min later my spring rolls were soggy on the bottom and my kung pao spaghetti was not coated well in the sauce. They just rushed my order out, they really need a better take out system. Oh and i walked out the door and quickly checked my bag that had no utensils so back inside for another 10 min until someone stopped and helped me. Better when you dine in, be careful when you call in for take out though!

Love CPK but just couldn't get past the ongoing sour washcloth smell that hits you as soon as you walk in the door. It seems to have gotten worse over the years. I wish they would do something about it!  The servers are always friendly and the food is always great but my sister and I just couldn't handle the odor and had to eat elsewhere.

Went to this restaurant because we are familiar with the food. The host was very nice. The restaurant was really busy and everyone was running around like crazy. So with that said I expected some delays. Our server was comical and witty but our drinks and water were served about 10 minutes after we sat down. Ordered appetizers and the bread came out at the same time. My friend ordered wine and after much waiting she was served at the end of our meal. Very bad food runners. Tables were dirty and waiters station was messy and unkempt. We still tipped more than 20%. After all, that's what the wait staff works for. Food was good as usual.

We chose to eat here about a week ago, on a Thursday evening and we had a party of five.  We were told it would be a 20 min wait but it was at least an hour.  The hostess did come out and update us after about 40 mins but we still waited an additional 20 minutes. The people at the tables would not leave and they didn't not ask them to leave (they were just chatting, not eating).  We were finally seated and then told the wait would be 35 minutes for food.Bread was not brought for 20 minutes. The salad did not have much avocado or chicken in it. I asked for more and she had to okay it with the manager before she brought it--this alone took at least 15 minutes.Finally they offered us a free appetizer.   Now everyone was very friendly, but I was not happy.  The restaurant apparently only has six burners and it cannot handle the amount of people the restaurant can hold. My biggest gripe is that they misjudged the time by so much and that it took them so long to notify us. We should have just left but I usually really enjoy CPK.  I guess I just need to change my location. I do think if we had had only four people our wait would have been much shorter. So large parties beware! This is probably not the place for you!

I have been going to this CPK at least once a week for 6 months.  The food is usually very consistent, the servers are pretty good (some excellent) and the selection of salads good.  Something has happened to this location!!  The wait for your order has become ridiculous. It had gotten worse over the last 6-8 weeks and we were told they had a new manager. We were seated tonight at about 6:30, ordered at 6:35,and got my food at 7:30.  My husband waited another 15 minutes before the server said his would be right up.  We asked for it to be packaged to go and it finally came 5 minutes later. Nearly an hour and a half to get our food.  Everyone in the restaurant was having the same problem and pretty upset at the long wait.  I will miss going there regularly and will need to find somewhere else to go on my weekly dinner out. Well decided to try again on 9/29/16.  Arrived at 6:00 pm and there were plenty of tables available.  This was probably due to the farmers market. We were seated immediately and this time our food came out to us within 20 minutes!  I am hoping they have fixed the food preparation issue for good and this wasn't just because it wasn't very busy. I will try again on a different night and hope for the same food service!

We've eaten in before and it's always been good. This time it's a review about the takeout. Ordered over the phone and hubby went to pick it up. We ordered a salad, pizza, spaghetti, and 2 fruit cups for the kids. When we opened up our order, we were shocked to see the fruit cups. Brown overripe pineapple slices and halves of grapes that looked like it was picked right off of our salad and put into the container! How do I know this? There were pieces of gorgonzola cheese on the grapes, the same cheese that was in our salad! Needless to say we threw out the fruit, disgusting! We couldn't even believe that they had the gall to give it to us!

We've eaten here probably 4 or 5 times and the place is fairly decent . They have great pizza and an excellent menu along with a full bar, beer and wine selections.  Today we shared a fresh corn salsa with chips, had a few drinks,  which was great because it's super hot outside,  then shared an order of jambalaya linguine. Everything was tasty,  but the jambalaya was excellent!  A bit spicy,  which is a Cajun trademark,  so that's just what the doctor ordered!  Our only complaint would be that it was crowded,  but that's fine with us because we sat at the bar with a hottie bartender girl! Bonus!!!  We'll come back!
Foods good and crowded as usual. Comfort food which is always good. Kailua restaurant has very nice group of helpful people.

Came here today for lunch, my second time at the Kailua CPK.  The food was well done, but gotta say that the customer service sucked.  The place wasn't even busy, but it seemed like everyone, from the host to our waitress, couldn't be bothered with us.  I am a frequent guest at the Ala Moana, Kahala, & Pearlridge locations and no matter how busy they are, the customer service is usually great.  I really don't think I'll be back.  There's a lot of other restaurants to choose from.
Lunch service was relatively quick as it was busy. Our server, Sasha was great!  Only thing they missed was the pine nuts in the Quinoa and Arugula salad.

Here we go.... I literally can't believe what a horrible experience we had at this restaurant. 1.  We were quoted 'a few minutes', we waited more than 30.  They promised us these two tables, although we didn't have a preference of where we sat... We just wanted to eat.  But they sat someone else there because suddenly they couldn't accommodate us there because there was a stroller? Whatever, I get it... My daughter is still in a stroller too.  So we wait AGAIN.  We finally get sat. 2.  Our server, Alex, had the techniques down.  Orders came out correctly.  We had everything we needed.  Drinks were full.  Speedy.  But he wasn't very personable.  He almost looked annoyed at us the whole time, but whatever.  I just wanted to eat so I could get to the bowling alley. 3.  Welllpppp folks, here it is.  I DO NOT EAT CPK'S CHICKEN because I don't care for the cuts or temperature they use.  I always forgo it, no matter what entree/salad I've chosen for the visit.  In fact, my sister (who is a vegetarian) always gets the same as me - BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad NO CHICKEN, sub avocado. So you're thinking I got chicken in my salad right? WORSE.  We don't even know what it was.  I yanked something out of my salad that I thought was cheese... Asked my family.  Then didn't think too much about it.... Out of pure curiosity, I asked our server... He said, "oh, I think chicken, but let me go double check".  At this point, I'm already annoyed because I don't like their chicken & I didn't want it!  Then he comes back & says, "We've come to the conclusion that it was chicken." Ok... Whatever.  But after thinking about it, IT DEFINITELY WAS NOT CHICKEN.  I asked the manager to come by & he was totally unprofessional.  He had no idea what he was doing.  He apologized, didn't offer an explanation, nor a remedy for the situation. When I engaged in conversation with him to try & find out what was in my salad (& what the avocado that I fed my daughter touched), he said "yea, it was chicken skin" WHAT?!??!?!??!!??! What does CPK use chicken skin in any of their dishes for?!?!? yea nothing!!! HOW DISGUSTING! Appalled & nauseated, I asked him if it was cooked because it definitely didn't looked cooked.  It was falling apart - which we all know "chicken skin" doesn't do.... He just said yea. I was over it - wanted to leave.  They offered free desserts, but being that I was already feeling nasty & didn't want chicken skin, or what they think was chicken skin to be part of my dessert, I kindly declined.  They comped my salad - but that was it. I left with a VERY sour taste in my mouth for this CPK in particular.  This would NEVER have happened at Kahala.  I will not be returning to this CPK any time soon, or ever actually. At least I didn't end up in the ER, right? The mysterious salad ingredient investigation continues..... ugh!

Our experience from the moment we walked in was superb! The service was perfect, the food was very good and everyone was very welcoming! We ordered the California Cobb salad, Waldorf salad and mushroom/pepperoni/sausage pizza. We will definitely be back. Mahalo CPK!

I love California Pizza kitchen but not for their pizza.  I love them for their sandwiches and salads!  On this visit, I had the signature BBQ chicken salad with the dressing on the side.  The salad consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, cilantro, moist chunks of chicken, and I added avocado.  I have also tried their thai crunch salad and their cobb salads which are both very tasty as well.  I like a lot going on in my salad and CPK satisfies me in that regard.  Their California Club sandwich and the Grilled Chicken sandwiches are really good too - just the right amount of veggies and protein (you can choose either chicken or turkey).  This was my first time to this Kailua location and I would definitely come back here.  The agave mojito was perfect - not too strong and just the right about of sweetness.  Perfectly refreshing on a warm Kailua day.  Our server, Koa, was very attentive without getting in the way.  He seemed to know exactly what we wanted before we even said it.  How did you know I wanted to drink my desert!?  It gets a little loud in CPK, even in the outside seating, but if you can get past that, its a great place to eat!

My review would be too long to type.  So the short of it is- the worst customer service ever.  And that was to My parents who are older (70's).  They were unprofessional (especially the manager) - maybe because my parents don't look like the typical "Kailua" customers even they have lived in Kailua about 60 years.  Never again will I ever go to this establishment!!

Food took awhile to come out. When it did I had no utensils. Took another 5 minutes for that. Refills were slow. Bill came out fast though. Change came back slow. I don't get this place lol gives the other cpks a horrible name!

Wow what absolutely shifty service. We saw our server when he took our drink order and then when he gave us the check. The rest of the time we got basically every other server in there.  Our salads were underdressed and bland, we had to ask for extra dressing twice. We had to ask for our drinks, they went missing... Not coming back to this location! We gave a $3 tip on a $30 tab and I think that was generous at best.
Perfect place for meat pizza lovers. Free wifi and large variety of pizzas, pasta and salads. Seating inside or outside. Is not expensive.
Food is ok but the quality of service has gone down once again.  No one checked on us.  Had to wait for a glass of winen forever.  And the utensils still had food stuck on it.  Yuck!

I love CPK. The patio here is nice in Kailua-people watching. I was disappointed in the Sicilian Pizza-It was over cooked and tasted like I was eating a cracker with pizza toppings on it.   Now I know it's a thin crush pizza-but this was a little much...

My husband & I used to love going here probably about once a month until last night. My husband, a friend & I had dinner here last night & we made a promise to never return. While we know the restaurant was busy we have never had to wait 50 minutes for pizza. My meal came out 25 minutes before the other 2 so that already was uncomfortable. In the 50 minutes we waited just for the pizza we never even had a refill on our drinks because the waitress only came back one & said she would talk to the manager to see what she could do about that wait. The manager did come over about 15 minutes later to tell us she would take care of us. After the food arrived my husbands pizza was not what he ordered, plus there was scraps of mushrooms & some other mysterious food on the plate the pizza came on. We didn't tell the waitress because we just wanted to get the hell out of there. Come to the conclusion of getting the check we had to pay full price for everything even though the manager said we would be taken care of. Again we didn't say anything because we just wanted to run as far away a as we can since we were just crawling out of or skin the leave.  It was the most unpleasant experience we've ever had dinning out. We will never return to this restaurant or any California pizza kitchen chains. Such a same because this was our go to spot. Lost a customer & will lose more when we pass the word on.
They are always very nice. Food is great and always made fresh! Mikey was a great m both service and was funny and helpful!
love cpk! Their menu is predictable but still very good. They have also stepped up with their drinks, recommend!
Had the jambalaya and was simply astonished by the magnificent taste and more than filling quantity

Most of this review is regarding the service I experienced.  Only a small portion of this review describes our meal.   Our family decided to celebrate my brother's birthday party by heading to CPK in Kailua at around 6:30p.  We arrived expecting a wait (it was dinner time, there were 7 of us total, and they do not accept reservations).  When we checked in at the desk, the greeter explained that the wait was going to be about 30-35 minutes and gave us our pager.  All 7 of us were present  and patiently waiting right by the water fountain.   30 minutes have passed...we may get called to go in soon.  We see some smaller parties who checked in after us getting seated before us.  Understandable - we had a large group. 5 minutes later...again more smaller parties get seated.  Again we understand. 5 minutes later...we see the staff arranging some outside tables for a large party.  "Could it be us?" we thought.  Unfortunately not.  Another large party of about 6-8 goes gets called to it.  That's okay.  We will continue to wait patiently by the fountain for our buzzer to vibrate. 5 minutes later...we were the only party waiting by the fountain.  We should be called very soon. 10 minutes passed...a total of 55 minutes pass and we still haven't been called.  We check back in with the greeter to see about how much longer it will be. When we checked back in, the greeter told our party that we didn't claim our table when the pager went off (in other words, placing the blame on us).  Wait a minute.  We were sitting right outside by the water fountain and had the pager with us the entire time.  The pager did not flash or vibrate during our entire wait.  Trust me, we wanted the d*mn thing to go off!   She also claims that she came out to call out our party name (again, blaming us).  Uh excuse me?!  We were, at one time, the only party waiting for seats.  Not once did any staff member call out to any waiting parties. Some of us were thinking going to another restaurant after the greeter told us that.  But the manager took over the situation, apologized to us, and offered to give us the next available tables.  We accepted. A few minutes later, we were lead to our table where a waiter greets us and asks if we would like any drinks.  A few minutes later, a waitress comes to the table, greets us, and asks us the same question.  There must've be some miscommunication going on since two staff members asked us what we wanted to drink.  But that's okay (it was a large party anyway).  The waiter did not return to our table after the initial introduction. Even though we were still upset that we waited longer than we were suppose to, the service at the tables was great.  Our waitress was upbeat and knowledgeable.  She served us very well and continued to check on us during our meal.  She encouraged someone in our party to get the Jambalaya, but get it with spaghetti noodles instead of the usual fettuccine.  He happily agreed.  Unfortunately the cooks served it with the usual fettuccine noodles.  He just decided not to make it a big deal and just ate it anyway.   Usually when I order the pasta here, it kinda erks me that I usually get a piece of another noodle that is not suppose to be part of my dish.  This time was no different.  I ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti and had a piece of penne in my meal. Though our experience at CPK ended well (except for the small screw ups), we wish it only started that way too.  Sure we may go back, but it may be a little while before we decide to do so.

If you want to go eat in the middle of a loud playground with kids running around you between tables and screaming while the parents are inside eating then this is the place to be. Smh Kailua. Good server. She was very attentive. Very Good food. But the whole playground atmosphere ruined the experience.

We asked for no cilantro and no pico on the tostada pizza with lime chicken. It comes out with the cilantro. (I have an allergy to cilantro and Chinese parsley). They take it back and come with another one. Then tell us that the lime chicken has cilantro in it - but I can pick it off. Wth? Service was awfully slow and we were starving. All the chicken was picked off by us. The waitress stood there and watched us pull it off. Then - she still charges us for the chicken topping. Wth? Never going back again.

I came here for a late lunch last week with co-workers, as we had just finished some field work in the Kailua area. We were all pretty passive on where we wanted to go, so CPK was a good and simple choice for us.  We got to the restaurant around 12:40pm on a Wednesday and the hostess told us it would be a 15-20 minute wait for a party of four. We opted for the first available table, since they have both indoor and outdoor seating. When we were buzzed back about 20 minutes later, they let us choose between indoor and outdoor - we chose indoor because we had been standing in the sun for the past few hours and were all pretty hot, and the AC inside seemed like it would be nice (and it was!). I had the California Club sandwich and opted for the side of Caesar salad instead of a cup of soup (again, my decision was driven by the weather/temperature outside...the soup sounded good!), and another coworker also got this same combo. The others got fish tacos and a BBQ chicken pizza. I learned to love the CA Club sandwich during my USC days, when I would use my dining dollars (or my sister's dining dollars) to go to the CPK to-go that was in the new Campus Center. This was my first time ordering the sandwich in an actual CPK and it seemed so much bigger than the to-go version I remembered! Unlike the version I was used to (where the whole sandwich was stuffed in a plastic take-out container), the bread on this sandwich was nice and warm, and the chicken and avocado were perfectly chilled. The Caesar salad was good but nothing out of the ordinary - I liked that the croutons were extra crunchy! Because I tend to eat small lunches, I finished only the side salad and 1/2 of the sandwich, and kept the other 1/2 of my sandwich for lunch the following day. It was a great portion size, especially for one of the lighter, more reasonable items on their extensive menu! The service was very good which made it a great experience! Our waters were always full, our waitress came back a couple of times to check up on us, and she even offered to split our check four ways (yes...we didn't even have to ask!). This is a great CPK, especially for those that live on the Windward side of the island, for a good simple lunch with great service. TL;DR - great sandwich portions, cool AC for indoor seating, and awesome service at lunch!

We moved to Kailua 2 months ago and decided to try CPK with our two children. Our first visit was so-so, but we figured it was an off night so we decided to try again. We were seated and didn't see our server for quite awhile. No water or bread was ever served. We ordered drinks and some mac-n-cheese balls for the kids. Our server had the sourest face--she never smiled at all. It appeared as if she was trying not to come over to our table or others in our section. She finally came over to tell us they were out of mac-n-cheese balls. Everything we were served was served first to the table next to us by accident: the drinks, the kids food and our meals. It got to the point where I'd just wave to the runner to let him know the food was for us. The food was not fresh. It had sat awhile. My pesto pasta was hard and sticky, no sauce at all. My husbands was dry too. The kids didn't even eat theirs. The only thing we enjoyed was the bread which we asked the runner for and finally received. We hardly saw our server other than when she was standing at the computer avoiding eye-contact with us. The people next to us were not served at all and I did see the manager or someone come and offer to comp part of their meal. I'm not sure what exactly was going on but for the price we paid for this meal, it was not worth the service or food. Very disappointed.

On a Tuesday night it took 30 minutes to get seated. Once seated it took forever to get our drinks, we had to wait for ever for refills and our food. She only gave two people a refill. There was 5 of us and a baby non of us liked our food and barely ate any. I got a raspberry lemon drop and it was extremely strong. My friend got the jambalaya pasta, we all tasted it and agreed it was overly seasoned, I fettuccine with red sauce and added chicken, the chicken wasn't cooked all the way and the noodles were undercooked. Her husband got a person pizza and only ate one slice. My husband got spaghetti with meat sauce and he was starving and couldn't even finish it. His friend got fish tacos and said he hated them. The only reason we went there was because it was a two hour wait at Mexico lindos for cinco de mayo. Bad idea, I don't think I will be returning. When I told the server that non of us liked our food the reason we didn't want a box she laughed.

I don't know what CPK Kailua changed (Maybe their chefs?) but their food was MAGNIFICENT. The presentation of the food had improved & the taste was much better. Usually my experience at this CPK is pretty mediocre but I think this is the first time I was impressed with their food & cooks!! The only downside is that the service is pretty slow compared to other CPKs

Came to eat at this CPK location on Valentine's Day and although service was great and the food was delicious I am very angry to find that when I checked my bank account just a few moments ago. Not only did they charge me TWICE but two separate amounts. One amount for $120 and one amount for $80.13 I will definitely be calling at exactly 11am to talk to them about this. It pisses me off because what if I had an emergency or a bill to pay, I'm not able to access that extra $100 until the problem is corrected. Needless to say I'm not a happy camper. ALSO I was only credited $58 dollars to my CPK reward account- if you're going to charge me over $200 at least credit me- sheesh! Will update after I call.

6/20/2015. 4: 20 Service- woman hostess : face hanging , looks very unfriendly , looks miserable to be here. First thing we see is a miserable face. Male hostess: young Caucasian boy upbeat, good personality .   Guy doing the take out orders behind the cash stand. Button up long sleeve. LAME Looks soooo bored. Low energy looks like it takes him a lot of concentration and energy to weigh and bag chips. Yawning in mid process while bagging the little bags of chips. ( must be heavy for him to carry) the only time he perks up is when one of the cute waitresses comes in his station. Answering phone with s bored tone.  Food: over priced for the quality we got. Tasted okay . kahala cpk way better.  Server : some were really good and friendly. Our waiter was okay I guess not really attentive . Need to pay more attention to detail.  Ordered lettuce wraps and only got 3 lettuce with a platter full of filling . REALLY! I had to ask for more lettuce. That's super lame! I'm still confused about who thought to put three pieces of lettuce for a platter full of filling. I don't get it. I can't believe how lame that was. I'd go so far as to say idiotic.  Flys- yes flys in the dinning area. I spent my entire meal shooing flys away from my food.    I think this is the worse CPK on the island, I would not recommend this location at all!!!!!! Don't waste your time or money,

Growing up in Kailua I've seen the many changes that my hometown has gone through.  I understand that change is good; new businesses, new homes, and an influx of residents.  I believe that with all the new changes, it's important for our new residents to assimilate to the local culture.  I think there's a drastic difference in the way our current Kailua businesses demonstrate Aloha from what I experienced growing up.  Unfortunately, there's just a lack of it.  We came to CPK for a nice lunch after some shopping.  The hostess informed us that an inside table would be a 30 min wait.  Looking in at the restaurant it appeared there were "creative opportunities" to fit our party.  You know, like pushing two tables together!  My mom tried to check in with the hostess several times, however, she was MIA or walked away.  My nephew checked in again with a sever and he was surprised that we weren't seated.  The staff were quick to react and profusely apologized for the oversight.  Our server, Kapena, was quick and tried to make the experience better.  Hopefully they can rub off some of that Aloha attitude on the hostess.

Great place to come in from the heat of summer.  Waiter was excellent.  Food is always good.  I had the fish tacos, not bad but I would not have it again. We visited the Kailua location which is very small.  We originally planned to eat somewhere else and ended up here.  Pricey but the atmosphere and food can always be trusted to be good.

Good ol' CPK!  Hearty pizzas, always love the Thai crunch salad and artichoke dip.  First thing trying the rolls - generously filled and their fried mac 'n cheese balls.  Both ono!!! Busy wait on a Friday night, 45 mins wait so browsed and did some shopping at Macy's next door.

Food is always good but the bar and wait service need significant improvement. It took almost 10 minutes for someone to ask if I need anything or if I'd been helped, even after all 3 servers walked by me more than once.  Once I ordered, I got my flatbread and ate it before my drink even showed up. Needless to say, I cancelled the drink order. Pretty sad seeing how there were only about 20 people in the entire place and absolutely no one at the bar.  Note: Expect drink delays when Tasha is behind the bar. Good thing they tell you the name of the bartender at the time you're seated.  Overall, the other food options are good. Pizza and Thai Salad are great.
Not a very friendly staff. Everyone seemed rushed and couldn't really understand staff because they were rushing and spoke very fast.  Very disappointed.

okay so the year i have been in oahu, ive come to this place roughly like 100 times with my husband our friends.  yesterday like no diffrent we went to cpk we love the avocado rolls.   we were 6 guest who waited 1 hour for a table then  finaly when we get seated.   we recieve austin as a waiter.  the joys( not really)  austin takes forever to brings our drinks.   brings only one bread which is sliced with 6 pieces and runs away.  comes back takes our order  everything is fine  yet i wanted pizza but no one to share it with so i ask him if they had a small size he offers  a kids pizza which has 4 pieces, lets get real im a grown female like are you serious.   finanly i getthe name of the size of the pizza down   and i still dont have extra bread after 20 min of seating in the table with nothing to eat i asked him for more bread now he thinks to bring additional bread for the entire table and he doesnt hand me the platye properly and theres bread and oil all over the table. i was livid ! he didnt even bring more bread!  so we are in  the middle of over meals talking have drinks  which we were on our 2 round after an hour of being there and here comes  austin's dad !  "hey guys  what branch yall in marines yes i served too. im a bit concern with the volume  and this is a family establishment." like seriously!!!   i asked him to excuse himself ( not in those words)  now manager comes and ask if tehres a problem after austins day(ex-marine) came to my table to reprimand us.  like b*** are you kidding me you didnt have a back bone to tell your customer that they are being a tad  loud !    the female is rude has no etticate and for someone in the restarant, customers are always right business she isnt shit.  needless to say that they lost my business and honestly there staff needs a reality check

Called for curbside and went when order was supposed to b ready. but took so long so went in. Problem with my rewards card, unable to process, finally processed. 15 minutes later handed me take out. Asked if my salad was in there. It wasn't, waited another 10 minutes. Asked to see manager, manager not quite sure if he was manager. No service recovery. Unacceptable! Whipped cream turned to liquid with heated dessert by that time.

We're new to Kailua, only been here a month. Wait was a little long (45 minutes) but we had a party of 8 so I'm sure that played a part. Liked the atmosphere. Our waiter Scott was really nice. Liked it a lot. Will be going back for more.

I always enjoy CPK and this is no different. There pizzas are always good and big salads, I was excited that they offered a wine flight, really classing the place up.   This particular location seemed a bit scattered though...  Our waiter had tables inside and outside, I got the wrong wine flight, they were backed up with there complimentary bread and when they brought it out it was three small slices for the three of us, and the waiter forgot to bring back our leftovers. We ordered the chocolate soufflé and butter cake, I would recommend the butter cake as the chocolate soufflé was deflated.   I also recommend the carnitas habanero pizza, the sauce is spicy and I loved it!!

I was very disappointed with the pizzas we ordered from CPK. The margarita pizza was dry and tasted like cardboard.. My wife liked or her pear and gorgonzola pizza. She said she would get it again; however, I think that's unlikely because I would never get another pizza from CPK. We paid $31 for 2 pizzas that were one or two stars at best. The free bread was very plain and not worth the calories. Bob's pizza is much better.

I love CPK. I've been told by a former employee of one of the other locations to never eat here because everything is frozen and shipped from California.. but I don't care! It's so delicious! Everything I eat here is so good! *Evil Laugh!* This location is nice because it's never too busy. You normally don't have to wait to be seated unless you have a large party.  The workers are always nice. Every time I come a new worker helps me but they're always on it with customer service. The only reason I gave four stars instead of five was because the last time I was here there was a huge swarm of mosquitos coming out of one of the vents our table was by and they kept flying by us.. It was gross. The workers did block off the area and spray it but then they migrated.. You know.. Otherwise, I recommend!

This four star  review is mainly for service inside the restaurant. The food is always good but what makes or breaks your experience is your server.  We have had the pleasure of having MATT as a server several times.  He is perfect. he is fast, friendly and helpful with the menu. I have a few food allergies, and he really knows the details of each dish. he always keeps an eye on the table, if your ice tea is empty he is right there, if you are looking around for something, he nips over, if it's a messy item, he brings extra napkins.  Order one dessert for three of you, he brings the extra spoons. You don't have to ask for everything, it makes the meal so relaxing. he is really personable and polite and just a great addition to any meal at the Kailua CPK.  I probably suppose I should do a separate review for their curbside pickup.  if I did, the stars would be maybe a 1. often get take away when I am in town visiting family, every six weeks, and in the 20 or so times I have gotten take out, I would say 90% of the time! I am missing not least one item or the item is wrong. I always ask too for them to review it. Makes no difference. I would also say the same percentage applies to extraordinary wait times. I've waited anywhere from ten to fifty minutes for my food once I've called at the curbside.
Unbelievable that you have to go to Hawaii to enjoy CPK. The level of service is so much better than in California.

Two stars because although the service was great, the food was boring. It was very expensive for not much flavor. We order the Garlic Chicken pizza and I expected something very flavorful, it was boring.  Also the windows are not tinted and we were seated right next to a family that was sitting outside. We awkwardly tried not to look in their direction. I won't be going back anytime soon.

Two words sum up my experience at the Kailua CPK:  appalling service.  In order to beat the dinner rush and to use my promotional thank you card, we headed over to CPK at about 5:00PM.  We were seated and ordered fairly quickly - wild mushroom pizza with chicken, BBQ chicken pizza, mac 'n cheese, and pesto cream penne with chicken. Then we were ignored for nearly an hour. After spending a day on the beach, we were all pretty hungry despite it being early.  Our bread and water were devoured in seconds.  No refills were offered, no one checked up on us to see how we were doing.  FOR AN HOUR!  The Ala Moana, Kahala, and Pearlridge locations are far busier, and yet the servers are attentive and the food comes out in a timely manner. The food - when it finally arrived - was really disappointing.  The pastas were cold - the mac 'n cheese sauce was starting to develop a layer of film across the top (well it would if it were sitting for an hour).  The $4.00 add on of chicken to the pesto cream penne amounted to a meager two small slices of chicken.  The wild mushroom pizza looked as if they had taken chicken chunks from their salad bar and strewn them across the top of the pizza after they baked it.  The large, square chicken chunks just rolled off of the slices of pizza as I tried to eat. Definitely won't be back to this location to use the rest of my promotional thank you cards.

Decided to treat myself to a lunch in the midst of running errands. It was quiet and peaceful.  Food was delicious and the staff was very efficient without being overbearing. I had a great time and will definitely come back.

They didn't have this in my hometown so this state is my first, and i have to say very good pizza its cooked to perfection. Its a very popular spot but the only thing is that their selection of pizza is small. Not sure why they sell taco's here but its not know for the taco.. its know for pizza. Try BBQ pizza is my personal favorite on the menu.. :)

These five stars go to our server Bryanna and the Manager of this location. Bryanna was an absolute delight. She was not only nice but accommodating as well. Our drinks were  great and our food even better but our server topped it off. The manager was not only managing but running food and working with all of the other servers. As busy as she was she still had time to stop by our table. We eat out at all kinds of different restaurants and have been to CPK numerous time but this was by far one of our best experiences. Thank you Bryanna. You are awesome.

HORRIBLE SERVICE! 3 STRIKES AND YOU'RE OUT!!! First BAD experience: ordered Kid's Mac n cheese for my 4 yr old daughter, as I was blowing it to cool it off, I found a STAPLE in it!! Mind you, I understand they have staples on their produce bags, etc...however, I feel they should have been more careful. I was NICE about it and alerted the manager quietly, so I would not affect other customers. He was ok, gave us 2 out of our 4 meals free. Ok...1st strike... Second BAD experience: Ordered their Kid's Mac n cheese AGAIN for my daughter and this time, found misc. items like bell peppers, green beans and a few other veggies that "accidentally" found their way in there. I don't mind veggies, but if you order something that is NOT supposed to have it, it is quite a surprise to find it in there!! 2nd strike.... LAST BAD EXPERIENCE: Just this past Saturday (12/8/12) @ approx. 5 pm, we walked in and were seated right away (they were not busy at all). The hostess brpught our menus and said our server would be right with us. There were 3 adults and 2 kids in our party this time.  We browsed the menus as our kids drew on their menus, then after about 30 minutes or so, NO ONE coming by to ask us if we had any questions, wanted water, etc....we thought, "Hmmmm....why did the people that came in AFTER us already get their appetizers and drinks??" Ok, so we looked at eachother and our 2 hungry kids, and decided to leave. We walked right out, NO ONE attempted to ask us what was wrong OR try to apologize. They all just LOOKED at us in shock and the hostess EVEN OPENED THE FRONT DOOR FOR US.  SORRY, YOUR FOOD IS NOT THAT GREAT AND AFTER THAT EXPERIENCE, I KNOW WE WON'T BE BACK EVER AGAIN!!!

We are frequent takeout customers though that could easily change. We ordered three pizzas. The one with the cheapest topping had the least amount. CHEESE! Thanks for all the crust. It wasn't supposed to be a CRUST pizza. Train your employees and monitor their work or get rid of them. You've been around long enough to know what makes a restaurant "tick". Employees are your asset or liability. Obviously they are a liability today.

Food was delicious. I got the BBQ Chicken Salad. So good. Our waitress though wasn't the best. Hard to explain but she just had this awkward vibe going on and kept asking us to hand her plates, take plates out of her hands, etc. She also asked for my girlfriend's pizza dough check-in number 4 different times and twice for me! That got really annoying with her coming back all the time asking "Wait, what was your number?".. I love CPK, the service just wasn't great this time.

I love going to CPK and have been going to this restaurant and the one in Ala Moana for a long time, but this past Friday (January 18, 2013) made me rethink coming back here. My boyfriend and I ordered our usual pizzas (Meat Cravers and Spicy Chipotle Chicken, i think that was the name) and I also had the Thai Crunch Salad. we were served by Jessica and I believe we had a manager come by our table to check up on us. Everything was delicious as usual at that time. When I went home, I felt something strange in my stomach and found myself THROWING UP THREE TIMES and going to the bathroom to relieve myself NUMEROUS TIMES as well as gaining a FEVER and CHILLS. My guess is that I got food poisoning. The symptoms are almost similar to the stomach flu, as it is flu season right now. I had to unfortunately miss TWO days of work because of this sickness! And I REALLY NEEDED the money! I could barely eat anything on Saturday and the sight of food made me sick on Sunday! I feel a little better today, but I still cannot eat as much food as I would like.  I will be writing a complaint to this CPK. They really need to watch what they are doing and be sure to get rid of expired food. Or they should send home sick employees.  My faith in this establishment has dimished.  Please be careful of what you eat here! Especially the salads!

While you always know what you are going to get with a tasty chain like CPK, you never know how one will vary from the next.  In this case it is much different than the Aiea CPK.   First off this CPK is much smaller.  Its laid out in a spiral and has 2 entrances which can be confusing.  Then the service was just meh.  Semi friendly, but not really memorable.  Since we tend to go to CPK often, we already knew what we wanted but it took the waiter awhile to come round and even ask what we wanted to drink.  Once the food came out, hubs said pizza was good (hard to mess that up at a place with pizza in the name), but the salad I ordered was just ok.  The toppings were sparse and it was mostly lettuce.  While I like veggies as much as the next healthy person, I love CPK salads for their tasty toppings.  This was something I could have whipped up at home.  Also, it did not seem as clean as the Aiea CPK and it was much, much louder.  We had to practically shout to hear each other! All in all, its convenient if you're wandering in Kailua, but there are so many better local options there you might want to give more consideration.  Unless you really, really want your CPK fix!
Very pleased with the service and food at this CPK location. Five stars, this location is nice for outside sitting to people watch and enjoy the weather.
Lunch was awesome. The food was very tasty and our server Abby was great. She made us feel like she really cares that we enjoyed our meal. Wish we had one of these on Kauai.

I'm NEVER disappointed when I go to the CPK in Kailua. I never had to wait for seating indoors or out and the staff was always friendly and attentive. I think they're actually robots that are digitally programmed to keep moving, smiling and be friendly! Anyways, stellar service towards their customers here.  I really can't complain about their menu selection...I've had most of their pizzas on the menu and like all of them. The avocado pizza though is a little difficult to eat since they lay thick slices of avocado on the pizza, so it becomes a mouthful when attacking it. Their specialty plates are okay (I've had the salmon which was fair) but their pizzas are a million times better, especially if you ask for your pizza to be made with the honey wheat dough. The food is always hot and the appetizers are always tasty. They got some good creative minds behind these CPK dishes. My favorite dessert is the pumpkin cheese cake special they had back in the fall.  Sign up for their emailings so you can get monthly specials and coupons. Also, they have weekly drawings for people to win a giftcard worth some crazy amount, like $500 in CPK food I think?  If you are already a CPK lover and appreciate their food, then come to the one in Kailua to get an even better customer service. Ive been there over a dozen times and never once had a negative perception about anything there!

A cozy little oasis in the middle of the town. The staff was courteous and friendly. I like the fact they wear a uniform; business casual but the ladies wore tight fitted LEVI jeans, so thats a plus! The food is tasty; and they have options that are spicy! Habanero sauce! Rare in these parts. Parking is abundant and freee!

I think I have bad luck with Hawaiian restaurants... Anywho, we had just finished up at the gym and were starving, so we stopped by KPC to grab a couple of salads to go. Well, after 30 minutes our salads were finally ready. The Manager could see how tired/hungry we were and deemed it unacceptable! So he gave us our salads for free, bless his heart. The salad itself was pretty good. Definitely acceptable post workout and starving.

They were so busy tonight! We waited 45 min to get in, however it was worth the wait. The waiter was great, however the bread and olive oil was brought out only moments before our pizza, which was about 35 min after we were seated.

For starters the food was great we had the silicon and supreme half and half....and Cesar salad.   But even better the staff is top notch, very professional, polite, and ready to wait on you.  A+++ in my book.

You know CPK, it's a national chain but they have a pretty decent menu.  Some menu items are prepared fresh, but beware of a couple items that taste like previously frozen dishes that were made in a factory... You will know what to get. For Kailua, it is a good family restaurant with a decent kids menu and has a nice patio to enjoy the weather. I like that they have fresh brewed ice tea and fresh lemonade. If you come on Fri or Sat, come before 6:00 or after 8:30 or you will have to wait 45 minutes for a table.

location: M C B H K BAY, HI
review: Living in Kailua Hawaii.  From San Diego California.  Not that any of that matters.  HI a distant second.  lol. Anyways, went to CPK on my wedding day for dinner and had great service and the food was excellent. P.S.  Great place or cocktails.
Great service. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. Great food. Highly recommend.  Everyone came over and said hi. Better than the mainland ones.

*disclaimer* We used to be frequent customers when this location was a CPK ASAP, the service and prices were great.  Since switching to a restaurant, prices have jolted up and service has took a huge dip.  Speaking of dip, we would come here specifically for the spinach artichoke dip, but the service was so bad *end disclaimer* We were here the previous sunday for mothers day and the service was decent.  Different people would bring out our food and we saw our waitress at the beginning when she took our order and at the end when she gave us the bill.  But hey, the service was better than our previous visits.  Back to this recent visit - My girlfriend and I arrived here for an early dinner on a Sunday which the restaurant appeared to be rather slow.  we were greeted and sat immediately; first time we did not have to wait.  The host gave us our menus and said our server would be with us shortly.  He did not go over any of the specials.  In the 10 minutes we were waiting, we decided what we wanted to eat.  15 minutes went by and we were started to get frustrated.  We should have acted like these 2 army guys (who arrived after us) who were flirting with the waitress because they got to order right away.  At that point, we were waiting for 18 minutes and happily chose to leave.  We were not stopped by the manager, any of the waitresses, or the waiter who looked at us like where were we going, and one of the employees held the door open as we left.  I want to say that the service was even worse and say all these bad things, but we expected it and thats why we won't be back. We happily went to Prima for the first time which is a walk away, and left there tummys satisfied.

CPK is always a good place to go. They have the best salad's and I prefer the Cobb salad. There portion sizes are perfect for salad's and they offer a full and half portion. I have the half portion and it's just the right amount for me during lunch. The staff was quick, but nothing stood out to me with their service.  I have tried a few of their pizza's and they are always tasty. The pizza is also not greasy like you'd expect at any other place serving pizza.  I'm not sure on their hours but their lunch hour tends to be busy and I went in there today and I thought that around 2 they would have slowed down. But they didn't. There was only 1 table open to sit at and they were pretty busy. Many of the tourists go here because of the location but don't pass by just because it's busy. They do have really good food.

Kailua Resturant Only - I Love this restaurant. I usually go to the one in Aiea. I was in the area so I stopped in at Kaliua. BUT I guess they were out of sync this afternoon. I sat and waited with my family for roughly 10 min. And didn't get greeted or approach by a server. It wasnt busy. There was atleast 3 servers in the inside section. I dont see what the issue was. We really were looking forward to it too. Next time. :)

About once a year, my German relatives visit us. I am lucky enough to have a brother in law who owns a brewery in Frankfurt.  Like most Germans, he is to the point. When it comes to dinner time he has little tolerance for Asian food. He barks: No Japanisisch! No Vietnamisch! No Koreanisch! No Chinesisch! That leaves a total of two restaurants left in Kailua and one is Peppinos (I don't even have the English skills to try to explain that place to him.) CPK it is. Parking is okay if you don't mind walking a quarter mile in a creepy parking lot. Our party of four arrives around 8 and its CROWDED. German brother in law complains about the noise level inside so request an outside table. 15 minute wait. We were seated outside by a nice local young man. He was explaining the new Peking Duck Pizza they are offering in his normal local tone. Halfway through German brother in law roars EXCUSE ME! I DONT UNDERSTAND WHAT YOU ARE SAYING! Local guy kept his cool and started again with my wife and I pointing at pictures of the thing. *Awkward tension* Waitress comes. She is a nice lady and has a loud voice. Whew. She helps my German brother in law through the menu patiently. By the way, he hates mushrooms too.  He orders a Sam Adams. Waitress bring him a frosty mug. He barks: NO GLASS TOO COLD! *Awkward tension*  He is a brewer by trade and likes his beer warm. Wait staff all over our great island are consistently perplexed by this. Appetizer comes. Spinach artichoke dip. Germans are happy. Wife and I share grilled salad and vege pizza. Germans get BBQ chicken salad and his wife gets Chinese Chicken salad. Dinner for 4=60 bucks. Not bad with one cold beer. Food is pretty consistent here. And the wait staff were helpful in not creating a cultural meltdown. Alles gut!

Ordered a salad from the menu and got 1/2 head lettuce with some cheese shavings. That's it! The pizza was cold, dry and tasteless. The price, ouch. The place is noisy you can't hear the waitress and possibly she couldn't hear me and that's why I got the crappy food. First and last time for me.

This California Pizza Kitchen is one of my favorite places to stop by for lunch whenever I am visiting Kailua. It is conveniently located in the heart of Kailua town with plenty of free parking available and easy to find as it is located right next door (ewa) to Macy's.   I find that the atmosphere at this location is nice as it provides a quiet and relaxing setting which is perfect for dining.  My favorite of all CPK's salads is the one and only original bbq chicken chopped salad (without avocado). Depending on how hungry I am will determine whether I will order half or full order of this popular salad. Since I was not feeling too hungry, it was going to definitely be the half order.  Even though the half portion did not look like much on my plate, it actually filled me up. This salad was generously coated with their special dressing which you can taste with every bite.     Since I have a sweet tooth I was not about to pass up dessert. It was time once again to order the butter cake for $6.75. I highly recommend ordering this specialty dessert as you will not be disappointed. To top off this cake, for an extra $1.50 you can enjoy it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. This butter cake is served warm with fresh whipped cream and best shared with two people as it is a very large serving. It is light, buttery and will literally melt in your mouth. Soooo delicious! In my book, this "takes the cake"! CPK's food as well as the service received was excellent as our waitress came around to check up on us and also made sure our ice tea glasses were always filled.   This is one restaurant where I will definitely visit again whenever I am in the area.

I went there two times and I wont go back a third time. We sat down at the bar for a drink when waiting to bee seated and I got a unclean glass of wine.... We where seated as soon as our drinks cam over the bar and we asked the waiter if he could get us a clean glass.  After 10 min he brings back the same glass now with no wine in it and its still dirty. He tells us he cleaned it.  Wow so now I need to ask for the his boss. He understood the situation and took care of it correctly. brought out clean glass comp more wine. and the drinks we had that  night where on the house.  After that i decided to try them again this time i have a different server and he was without exaggeration one of the worst waiters I have ever had. I wont go back there are a lot of good places to eat at this is not one of them. They need to wok on there customer service.
Everytime I come here I order the same thing - Wild Mushroom Pizza with Truffle Oil (this time) and Chicken... Avocado Egg Roll was pretty good, in fact every thing here is pretty good.

Love California Pizza Kitchen! We always have great waiters and waitresses too! Sometimes the wait for a table can be long, it is dpretty busy at night especially on the weekends. The Chicken Tequila pasta me has to be my favorite! It never fails! The lemonades and frozen lemonades are great too and the lemonade has free refills! The desserts are amazing too!  It is always clean and the manager has visited our table more than once just checking on how the servers are doing and to see if we have any feedback!

Every time I come here, I've never waited more then ten minutes for a table and that's saying a lot since this is a smaller cpk.  The food always comes out delicious and we've always received great service. Even when our appetizer was running late, the manager personally came out and apologized and even comped it!  Will definitely come back here.

Food is always good at CPK, too bad the service is not. .. our waiter never checked on us,  refilled our drinks and didn't come back till I had to ask another waitress for our check. Although he did wait on the tables around us. It was as though we were invisible. Bad service dude! I shouldn't have left him a tip.

I went here tonight expecting it to be pretty decent but NOPE. Everything tonight went wrong, and my family and I will NEVER be returning back again. After this experience, this place is a turn-off. If I could rate this place a 0, I would in a heartbeat. Even though we live in Kailua (5 minute drive), a 25 minute drive to Pealridge's CPK is totally worth it.  1. Overpriced OKAY food plus JUNK service = NEVER COMING BACK (not worth your time and money). 2. The waiter we had was NEGLIGENT/SLACKING/TERRIBLE: 3. The manager was the WORST/UNPROFESSIONAL. 4. The chips that came with the spinach artichoke dip was STALE and the proportion of dip to chip was off (we ran out of stale chips when there was half the dip left). 5. After I finished eating my chicken cobb salad (lettuce, boiled eggs, blue cheese, tomatoes, bacon, grilled chicken breast, and avocado) there was a random piece of grilled corn that was underneath my salad. Reasons for #2: 2A. He treated everyone else so well and making small conversations to them EXCEPT us. He rarely comes back to check on us, and isn't even a bit friendly like how he is to everyone around us.  2B. My mom ordered a salad and said no tomatoes in it, and when he brought it out she noticed it also had sun dried tomatoes, so she asked him nicely if she could get a new one without any tomatoes and sun dried tomatoes. He didn't even apologize for the mishap. He made an upset facial expression, took the salad, and walked away. 2C. After my mom asked for a new salad he became even more negligent and unfriendly to us, and he was talking to us so monotone and not making eye contact, plus I could tell that he didn't want to service us even more. 2D. He was no where to be found and never check back with us to talk about the update of the new salad the chefs were making. So we waited for another 10 minutes without anyone stopping by to check up on us and when he finally came by, he was clearing off another table so my mom was so impatient/upset about the negligent service, she said to cancel the order already and we wanted the check. He said okay and walked away. 2E. He came back 5 minutes later and said "oh the manager is going to come and give you the salad in a to go box." What wasn't clear about canceling the order, and to give us the check? We didn't even ask for the manager at all, we just wanted to pay and leave. But NOPE. Reasons for #3: 3A. I'm guessing the waiter made a big deal about my mom's mistake of having the sundried tomatoes in the salad so that's probably why the manager came by to talk to us I guess. We didn't ask for the manager or anything, my mom again, just asked nicely for a new salad without tomatoes and sun dried tomatoes in it. But the manager approached us the WRONG way.  3B. He came by and asked my mom "What's wrong?" and my mom was wondering who this guy was so she said "what?" like any person would. and he then said " There was sun dried tomatoes in your salad?" and she replied "OH, Yes, I told the waiter that I don't want any tomatoes in the salad since I get acid reflux from eating it" and then the manager goes "oh, okay" and walks away. HOW STRANGE: FIRST, he didn't properly introduce himself or anything (so we didn't know who he was), and SECOND, he didn't apologize for the mishap (as the manager the first thing you should do besides introducing yourself is apologizing for the mistake; DUH).  3C: Since the waiter didn't want to service us anymore the manager took over. So we asked for the check and then 5 minutes later the waiter told us that the manager is coming with the salad in a to-go-box. and then the manager arrived. 3D. He placed the package on the table and crouched down to talk to my mom. He said in a FAKE calm/sad voice "I'm so sorry for the mistake, I hope that you come back to eat here again." and my mom said "No, I'm never coming back here again. The service was terrible." and he said "I know.." My mom then replied "Even though we live in kailua, we'll drive to pearl ridge and eat at that restaurant instead from now on." And he didn't answer back and paused for a bit, got up, and then grabbed us the check. My mom paid through a gift card, and then he came back to give us the receipt, and walked away. And while we walked out he said to us "I hope you have a better evening............And happy holidays!" LIKE REALLY, REALLY?  After all that terrible service, he said he knows about it?? and then while we were leaving he said "hope you have a better evening and happy holidays"!?! This place is a joke. I will never ever be coming back again and I hope I saved you a trip to the worst CPK on Oahu to dine at.

I used to LOVE CPK but not anymore!  It's been awhile since I've gone back to a CPK and I have heard that they are not that great.  I went to the CPK in Kailua the other day for lunch and ordered a soup and salad.  It wasn't bad, but it was not the same.  I went back for lunch again a few days later and ordered the same damn thing ... and it was horrible.  The soup tasted funny and cold and my chicken salad had chunks of "frozen" chicken that I couldn't even get the fork through.  I felt sick and burped up the soup the remained of the day.  Overpriced, poor quality, and smaller portions, I can't say that I will be returning to a CPK any time soon.

I have to say, for having such a big party on a Saturday night our service was spectacular! thank you to the hostess for seating my party of 8 so quickly and thanks your Kristin for being such an awesome server!  Not only did it take all of what, 5 minutes to get seated..but our food came out quickly as well! 4 of us shared 3 items: Chicken piccatta $18.10 Habanero carnitas pizza, thin crust, extra cheese $14 1/2 roasted veggie salad $10 Bottle of Ecco Dimani $20 ...and we had leftovers! (no wine leftover of course!) Kristin was just on point. She was so incredibly sweet and knowledgeable about the menu! The manager Chris checked up on us and made sure everything was going well. Not to mention the great team work from the other staff delivering the food, refilling drinks, etc. I brought my friends to this location and they LOVED IT!!!
A server named Russ just sneezed into his arm and then delivered our food although going to wash up. Fucking gross.

I went to CPK today for lunch and received excellent service. Johnell was our server. She made our dining experience very pleasant and enjoyable. The manager even came over and talked to us asked us how our food was and asked if we needed anything. Definately recommend them. Great food and customer service!

Let me start by saying that I'm generally NOT a fan of chain restaurants - I like keeping it local and love finding fun hole-in-the-walls.  That being said, I'm such a big fan of CPK. I appreciate their consistency, their reasonable prices (although they just increased), and their AMAZING drinks.  Drinks, you say?  Yes. CPK has a cherry-lime-spritzer-thing with 3 Olives Cherry Vodka that I am O-B-S-E-S-S-E-D with. It's deliciously dangerous, especially when you make it a double for "just a dollar more". Um, yes.  I love their huge salads, their yummy yummy in my tummy pizzas (especially the classic BBQ chicken and 5 cheese - mmmm!), their drinks, and especially their avocado-bacon-chicken eggrolls - I could eat a zillion of them.  I've also always had great service here - most chain restaurants have AWFUL service, but CPK's doing something right.  It's freaking good, man. Let's go there right now.  Yelp 365 Challenge 6/365

I like that they have outdoor seating. You can bring your pet to dine with you here! Star for that; but then again, Kailua has always been generous to animals & their owners. The first & last time we'll ever dine here. Our server did not take our order correctly. He then gave us cream with lint in them, after notifying him, he didn't even apologize & gave us another one with lint. We didn't have silverware to use. We told him numerous times, took a different person to give us our forks. The inside of the restaurant really needs to be cleaned- carpets are smelly needs to be shampooed. The servers kept breaking the plates & what not. If that wasn't enough, they billed us incorrectly.

The last two times I've been to this location, the service has been terrible.  Tonight my daughter wanted ice cream after dinner and it took the server 15 minutes to bring it out.  Once he brought it out, it was melted.  Just terrible..
Service at this location is less than compared to Ala Moana.   Thin crust pizza and all types of salad is excellent.   Don't really care too much for the sandwiches.
Love my CPK. For fast yummy pizza in Kailua with curbside pick up, CPK is great. Love that I can customize my salad too-- I have a thing for "no this and no that" and they are very accommodating!!
I avoid chains like the plague, but these guys make good food. The garlic chicken pizza was very good. Service was excellent.

My wife and I went last week to the Kailua location. Food's not bad I had the bbq chicken pizza and caesar salad, soooo good. Unfortunately I heard the woman manager chewing out our waitress for whatever reason. Poor girl was almost in tears. Manager was super rude and unprofessional. Later on we overheard the same woman talking to some other staff members, totally disrespectful. I mean some of the things she was saying were just unacceptable. I've worked in the service industry for years. If my manager talked to me the way she did, I'd be out. Wish I could remember our waitresses name. Either way it made for a really crappy experience.

I'd been to CPK in Cali, so I didn't have the highest expectations for the Kailua location. Set the standards low and you won't be disappointed! True to chain restaurant form, this CPK lived up to my mediocre expectations. I met up with a few of my girls here for a little ladies dinner and drinks. I was about an hour before they closed, but you could definitely tell our server was ready to be out the door and get his Saturday night party on...ok, dude, Jake, actually was his name, it's not even 10p, you'll have plenty of time to go rub up on girls at The Pub and drink your Smirnoff Ice, but get me my mojito first!!! And for someone from the east coast, dude did not quite catch on to sarcasm... That being said, the raspberry mojito I had was fabulous! Not too weak, and just a hint of mint, yum!!  I decided to try the "local" CPK special and get the salmon fillet. It was pepper-crusted and grilled and came with wok-style veggies. It was surprisingly good! The veggies were a little oily, but I still inhaled them! Same with the salmon! Surprisingly good fish from a chain restaurant. Not good...the price! The total for one drink and the salmon was $28 before time, yowza!! It wasn't that delectable! I will say that the salmon was the most expensive thing on the menu, but come on...for that much I could have fed 4 people at Fatboy's! I'd definitely return for happy hour drinks, but not for dinner, not while being within smelling distance of Teddy's and Fatboy's!

No... I am not a fan.  CPK serves your typical mediocre, souless chain food... but in a town like Kailua where most places suck, it becomes pretty acceptable. The 4 stars is for their new Korean Tacos on the small cravings menu.  Those who follow the L.A. dining scene know about the craze started by the Kogi Taco Truck... Korean style "BBQ" meats wrapped in a griddled corn tortilla, with a little onions, cilantro, salsa etc., or perhaps some kimchi... an instant fusion food classic.    I have personally suggested to various Taco joints in Oahu that a Korean Taco would do well here... no one has acted upon... kudos to a bureaucratic, big business beating supposedly nimble entrepreneurs to the punch.  The execution is not half bad, and right away one of the better things to eat on their menu (albeit pricey for the mediocre quality of ingredients they use).

Somehow this CPK does not taste as good as others.  I went to the CPK in Pearl a week before I went to this one and both times I got the BBQ Chicken Salad and had a slice of pizza.  Somehow the salad did not taste very flavorful and the pizza crust somehow was not as good as usual.  The service was good, but the food not so much.

Not sure I need to write a review since the family waited over an hour for a 15 minute wait to be seated on the inside of the eatery.  My son and family visited us from Kansas and love this pizza but don't have one close to their home.  Here's the scoop.  Approached the host and asked to seat 6 adults, 1 child, INSIDE.  Host tells me it will be 10-15 minutes; we are second on the waiting list.  We wait outside and watch the crowd grow in small groups.  After 25 minutes the host asks if we will take a seat outside.  ???  I'm thinking that English must be a second language and she may have an attention disorder and tell her again that we want to sit inside because the ladies in the group hate the birds flying around the tables and pecking near their feet.  She said it will be about 20 minutes.  ???  Wait, you said 15 minutes 25 minutes ago.  We have watched tables empty and then be filled again while we are waiting how can it be 20 more minutes??  She apologizes and I decide to just wait.  After 20 minutes we watch the outside tables slowly empty and note that people are still being seated inside.  The manager comes out and asks us to take a seat outside.  ???  Are you kidding me?  Is it that hard to manage tables?  We simply need two tables pushed together but obviously this strenuous planning undertaking is far above her limited mental capabilities.  We elected to take our business, and money, elsewhere.  We will not return ... unless of course we need a good laugh.  Save your money and go to another California Pizza Kitchen unless, of course, you have the patience of Job and the humor of Red Skelton.

I love that this is next to the hub of stores in the town center, like Pier 1, Macys, etc.  Met a friend for dinner and the table quickly filled up after 5PM.  CPK fare is standard & I settled on chicken alfredo pasta vs a pizza/salad combo.  After it arrived, I wished I had ordered differently as the pasta was dry & the chicken breast seemed like it might have been under a heat lamp all day.  Could I have sent it back?  Of course but it wasn't bad enough to make a fuss, so I ate what I could and left the rest.  A lot of the rest.  What the pasta didn't do, the customer service made up for 10 fold.  The wait staff was so polite & attentive and I rather liked the intimate ambiance of this location.  I'll probably return, just not for that dish...

I always enjoy going to CPK with my kiddos.  We like the kid friendly atmosphere and their consistency with great service and food.  However the Kailua location...not so great.  Our first visit the service was incredibly slow.   Our second visit incredibly fast...so fast where our salads and entrees all arrived at the same time.  Crowded table and cold entrees.  Not good.  On both visits they neglected to refill our drinks even after a request.  They also overlooked our empty plates and never cleared our table until dessert was served.  So annoying!  It's the little things that they seem to not get.  Which for me, leads to a disappointing experience.

WHAT?  HUH?  EXCUSE ME?  I'M SORRY, I CANT HEAR YOU. I'M AT THE NEWLY REMODELED CPK IN KAILUA AND EVEN THE WAITRESS CANT HEAR ME. IT'S JUST TOO LOUD IN HERE! ..... Stepping outside - ....whew!  Much better. It's is truely louder than Lucy's inside the new CPK. (-3 stars) the place is no bigger than a starbucks with glass walls and tile. Plus they pack you in and it gets very, very loud. Our poor waitress had to bend down about 4" from our faces to hear us YELL our order. Terrible planning for an open kitchen/tiny restaurant.  Food:  now it is the standard menu. Which we all know and understand. Except I didn't feel I got enough food for the price. $11 for half a cob salad should still be a decent size. Not here. $5 cup of soup should at least be hot. Not here. I could pay $3 more for a pizza at Pizza Bob's down the street, take it home, have it feed 2 people easily AND be able to have a conversation.  And that is what I'll do in the future. (-2 stars for lack of even a perceived value)  Service:  spot on when not unsure. It is day two of their opening so I expect it. +1 star for a waitress that kept the drink refills coming before I even knew I needed one. I will probably give them another shot in a few months. Let them work out the kinks and if you do go - SIT OUTSIDE so you can hear yourself think.
Nothing too amazing.  Quality "sit-down fast food."  The pizza I ordered was average.  The service and atmosphere were great!

Good service, waiters & waitresses including the manager are very attentive but food was bland. :/ The Caesar Salad had more taste then their Garlic Cream Sauce pasta. My sister in law also ordered that & said the same thing, it had a raw flour taste & no garlic taste at all & sauce was on the watery side.

My roommate and I went in for dinner. We got a pizza and pasta. My roommate served herself some pasta and started eating it. When I went to serve myself some pasta I noticed a big black curly hair. It was disgusting. I called the waitress over and told her about the hair so she took it back to replace it. A couple of minutes later she came back and said "I just gave the pasta to the cooks and they think it's a hair off a cooking brush". First of all I don't care what it is it shouldn't be in my pasta so keep your excuses to yourself. Second of all that is a lie because butter brush bristles are not long and curly and nobody brushes butter on pasta the butter is cooked in the sauce. As if things couldn't get worse the manager came by and said "I'm so sorry for the miscommunication". WHAT!? There wasn't a miscommunication there was a big nasty hair in my food. They brought us a new pasta but we were pretty grossed out so we didn't eat very much of it.

I have eaten at the kailua CPK and the service I received was the worst. The server I had was so unprofessional his name is "MAGIC" real name is SCOTT and it took him over 10 min to greet us at our table after sitting down, but finally He came and  offered us drink but before we could even finish saying the word water he was walking away from our table! He didn't once come back to ask how we were doing.. we also were trying to be friendly back and asked him if he real name was "MAGIC" he didn't respond he just walked away... the bill comes it was $46.00 we gave $50.00 not saying anything about change. "MAGIC" took the tab comes back to our table with the tab and says did you look at the bill correctly with the $4 dollars left over and I said yes and he said I'll let you think about it. We leave the $4 as we are walking out of cpk he follows us out the door and announces out loud in front of the whole CPK thanks  for the tip! I called the next day to talk to a manager about the experience  I had the night before and all he could say was sorry

that old saying" if it aint broken , dont fix it"  ... I have been to many CPKs including california... over priced... experimental food fusion wannabe food.. Best way to eat here is to find out who the good chefs are.. then it can be rewarding.. other wise the newbie chefs and staff will make your dining experience a bad one... which happened to me recently... so all  i can say... I wont be going back..  save yourself trouble and head to wholefoods, crepes noka oi...

I was never really a HUGE fan of CPK like a lot of people in Hawaii are, (particularly my family!) and so when it opened in Kailua I was like, "ehh...whatever, no big deal."  But a month ago and more recently tonight, I dined at CPK ASAP in Kailua and was pleasantly surprised...probably because I didn't expect the place to wow me nor the food to thrill me.  The place is incredibly popular, filled with mostly families with young children (probably because they have mac and cheese on their menu) and a smattering of visitors and locals alike.  We arrived before the crowd hit so got a seat immediately inside at a table in a nice corner with a fair amount of space.
