I ordered a veggie sandwich on a garlic and cheese foccacia with aioli sauce, roasted red peppers, mixed greens and eggplant was actually fairly decent. While difficult to eat (the sandwich is cut in half and has roasted veggies and lettuce oozing out), it does taste good going down!  You can choose from a salad or a soup (I elected to try the pea soup) to accompany your meal. The soup was lukewarm but I was hungry so I ate it anyway!  My dad ordered his regular, a pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza; my mom her regular, garlic fettuccine with shrimp and chicken; and of course my daughter, HER favorite, mac and cheese!  Everyone wiped their plates clean full from a decent meal!

2/11/12, while doing some shopping this past weekend. My wife and were hungry and choose CPK. Went inside and got a seat quickly, staff was friendly but a little slow (was at half capacity). The food was great, we shared a guac dip & chips, Thai Pizza (too much bean sprouts) and avocado egg rolls. Reasonable price lunch for two.

This is a very busy place, but all of their locations are pretty busy. I always get the cobb salad and the habanero carnitas pizza. The pizza comes with the salsa on the side since it's pretty spicy, but I love it and use the whole bowl every single time. Service is always pretty good for such a slamming restaurant and the flavored iced teas are delicious and bottomless.

Big menu lots of options falls short on the details. It was my first time going there  today and we ordered a pizza and pasta. The pasta was cold and the pizza was burnt. They charged us for refilling our sodas. Worst service my water was never refilled. Overall It's an awful chain food restaurant that will disappoint.

Wasn't planning on another review but this visit was out of the ordinary so here ya go! Only a 4 Star because of initial experience. After we were seated at our table for 10 min as multiple servers ignored us as we sat w/no server/drinks/etc..The general manager Jennifer noticed and immediately came over and was super kind and professional about the matter. She must have spoken to her other staff me ever a regarding the issue because the rest of the night everyone offered premium service! I was impressed at everyone's effort to turn an unpleasant situation into a great experience. From that point forward everyone was super attentive and helpful. We were given complementary appetizers, desserts, and 2 "Be Our Guest" cards gifting us a free entree and drink at our next CPK visit. For our free appetizer we tried the Cajun Chicken Tortilla Rolls which were delicious! And for our free dessert, Tiramisu, which was creamy fab and just melted in your mouth! A big thank you to the general manager Jennifer and shift leaders Kalena and Mike! I have been to many places with horrible service and the staff could care less. This CPK staff truly made the effort to make it an enjoyable experience     Mahalo Nui Loa to you all! Will definitely be coming back!
I love this place! Always have! I do miss this wonderful young lady named Ayla though. She was quite the happy face. :)

Drinks: Ordered within 2mins of seating were unapologetically served nearly 20mins later - long after the appetizer had arrived. One bottle of beer and a glass of sangria should not be difficult on a slow monday evening.  Spinach and Artichoke dip: Extremely greasy and had a disproportionate amount of chips for the small amount of dip included. BLT pizza: Tasted like a BLT sandwich you could make at home - nothing exciting, interesting, or overly tasty about it. Kung Pao Spaghetti: Didn't taste as greasy as it looked. Good but not great. Because it was so greasy the peanuts (which were not chopped) could not adhere to the pasta and thus were left almost entirely to the end of the dish. Brownie Sundae: Served, again, more than 20 mins after ordering. Easily the WORST I've EVER tasted. Stale, nasty brownie, melted yet freezer burned, 'gritty' ice cream, chocolate fudge that somehow managed to have the consistency of a charleston chew, and stale walnuts that tasted like they'd been left uncovered for months which consequently left the generic, over-processed cool whip also tasting rancid. Dessert was comp'd on account of being late not DISGUSTING. Service: Our server seemed incompetent, new, or both. Atmosphere: Lovely, clean, and well appointed throughout.

I LOOOOOOVE this place!~  And what's so great about it is that you don't HAVE TO GET PIZZA!~ Nope! They have sandwiches, fish tacos, and pasta (among other things)!  I can't explain how great this is. Just go. Go and get some grub. :)

This is my 2nd time coming back to this CPK and I liked it better then the first time.....service is ok. Drinks came out really slow tho, like almost 20min later after ordering it. But they were good. Definetly,  get the strawberry basil martini, Yum! The garlic shrimp and chicken fettuccini was really good, get that!

Do not order food to go from this location. My wife telephoned in an order and had to wait an additional 45 minutes past the time they provided as a pickup time then received miserable customer service once the food was delivered. I shrugged that mistake off and tried to order via their app. I showed up at the pick up time they provided and called their curbside service and informed them that I was there. 15 minutes later they brought out an order for someone else then returned and told me they had "technical difficulties" and just got my order. They told me they could rush the order. I told them "no" and left. Again, do not try to order food to go from this location.

The service was awesome. Even the manager was on duty, making sure every one was enjoying their meals. My coke was always filled, my favorite pizza, California Club and the Wild Mushroom were delicious! Also my new favorite pupu is the Avocado rolls. A must try!  I would say keep up the good work!

I went here with Thomas O. after a "hard days work."   Of course I was super excited to eat good food.  I have a set number of things that I alternate between, and I was looking forward to choosing.   They said the wait was going to be about 20 minutes ... on a Tuesday night.  It was unreal.  I didn't think it would be that crowded.  But we ended up waiting for about half an hour :( We finally got seated we decided on our food and drinks.  I got my Miller pretty quickly, and Thomas got his iced tea.  However, he was sad that there was no sugar.  A few minutes later the sugar came.   When I go to the CPK in Ala Moana and Pearlridge, I usually get bread ... but no bread here.  That made me really sad. Our food came out pretty quickly --- as it should because it used to be a CPK express.   I opted for the Chinese Chicken Salad :)  One of my favorites.  I like the chicken because it's always so tender, and there's not too much sauce and not too little.  It's a really perfect combination.  I didn't finish the whole salad (I never get halves of anything.  Go big or go home), so I took the rest home ... and right when I walked into the door my mom said: "Oh is that from CPK?" and stares at me with her longing eyes.  So I gave the rest of my salad to her. Thomas finished his iced tea in the middle of his meal, but no one brought or even asked if he wanted a refill.  I got a water, but Thomas only got an iced tea.  So he was pretty screwed.   I don't know how long we waited for the check.  The place was almost empty, and we saw the servers/bussers just standing in a circle talking story.  We tried staring at them to get their attention, but they seemed unamused by us.   Finally our check came, and Thomas's iced tea refill came.  Too late already breh!

I am disappointed with the unsatisfactory service my friend and I received here last night.  Nicole K. and I had decided before we went to work that we were going to CPK as a treat afterwards. (Of course I forget my rewards card but who cares, I'll be getting one tonight...well, little did I know this location dishes out long waits, shitty service (aka no service) and no rewards cards!) We arrived at 8:00 to find they are packed with a 30 minute wait time (on a Tuesday this is strange, but this store is smaller than most of the other locations on island.)  While waiting we sat next to the hostess booth, we overheard a family complaining to the hostesses that he could have gotten better service from them instead of their server. For some reason they had messed up orders and plates dropped...dumb stuff that shouldn't happen basically. All right, planny chain restaurants get those kine problems but they fix them. Right? Well, our server according to my receipt was a guy named Kealoha. (Did we get any Aloha while dining here? Nope.)  We got our drinks very quickly; a miller lite for Nicole and and Iced Tea for me. But where's the sugar. On the verge of hysteria I shuffle around the table looking for my sugar. I NEED MY SUGAR. 2 minutes later, the dish of sugar packets is nearly shoved in my face. Yes, I finally start breathing again. But please be nice about it Kealoha.  Then we waited what seemed like forever and a day for our food to come out. By now its 845 and we're starving. At least offer us some of your famous sourdough bread and buttah to carry us over.  But no. No bread. No buttah. Our food was delicious though. That made me quite happy until I ran out of iced tea.  So we finished what we planned to eat and started staring and random servers. You know the "I want my effin check now" stare because our server had be AWOL for the duration of our meal. Uncool! Finally he came around to collect our plates and serve me another Iced Tea. I wasn't about to touch it because it took way too long and without apology.  I may sound snooty right now but when you're earning a tip, at least try to make an effort.  To top off one of the worst experiences I've had at a CPK restaurant is the absence of our customer appreciation card. For the past 3 summers or so, CPK has been giving out these little cards that contain rewards. You're supposed to bring them back on your next visit to open them, revealing what you've won. The last one I got was 10% off my entire meal. This time I went home without a customer appreciation/loyalty reward card. I guess I'm not an appreciated customer. I guess the tables directly next to us and behind us were appreciated because they got cards.  In all, I think they can do better and will continue to go here.

They can't even put romaine lettuce in a BBQ chicken salad!? My salad had mostly tortilla chips!?  My pizza was burnt?!  I have been to CPK many times, but this location sucks! Another customer waited 1. Hour for 1 of his entree before they brought it!? Terrible food and terrible service. I live in Kailua, but I will only go to the Kahala or Alamoana locations after this bad experience!

We only had take out from CPK but I wasn't that impressed. For 2 pizzas and a salad it was $55. They skimped majorly on toppings on both pizzas and they weren't even hot when we got them. The salad was pretty good...shrimp miso something or other. It was pricey for the size and didn't come with enough dressing. I think I had high expectations since I'm a California girl and have frequented CPK's in California.  I can't say anything about the dining experience since we didn't eat in the restaurant but we may try it and see if it was a one time bad time or just because it was take out.

We sat at the bar tonight, what an awesome idea. Janice the bartender was an excellent host and servant. The food was amazing. We started with the spinach and artichoke and had the club pizza. What a great choice. The seats are perfect for seeing the food come out to the customers. Love this place. My wife and I first drank mojitos and ended with margarittas. The drinks topped off the night. My favorite place to eat when in Kailua. The atmoshere was lively and the place was packed. We had a great time and enjoyed the harmony of the restaurant.

Ok, I love CPK food, don't get me wrong, but the Kailua location's service leaves much to be desired. I ordered my pizza on the mobile app for pick up like I've done many times before at the Kahala location, figuring that my drive to Kailua from KCC was more than enough time to get my order ready. I get to the Kailua CPK, park and walk inside, and told the hostess or waitress (not sure what she was) that I was picking up a take-out order. The girl took me to the take out counter, but had no idea how to ring me out. She wanted to charge me again when I'd pre-paid for my order online. Another employee showed her where the tickets for takeout orders were and I signed the credit card receipt. She tells me my order wasn't ready quite yet and it would be a few more minutes. I thought "hey I ordered about a half hour ago! The app said my order would be ready in 20 minutes and I gave them extra time!" but having experience working in customer service, I didn't want to fuss. I sat and waited for about 20 more minutes before standing up and having the same girl ask me if I'd been helped. I told her I was waiting for my takeout order. She called someone to help me who pulls my pizza out of a warmer. It had been ready the whole time I was waiting!!! I was so irritated. I mentioned it to the guy and he rolled his eyes as if the girl did that all the time and apologized. The girl who helped me originally didn't even check if my food was ready!!!! I didn't make a fuss because it wasn't his fault, but I was upset I'd waited for a half hour and my food had been ready the whole time. Not to mention my pizza was pretty cold by the time i got home to Kaneohe.
I went there last night and sat at the bar. The bartender Janice was awesome and made the experience even better. The food was good, the service was great, definitely be going again soon.

My cousins and I came to eat an early dinner to avoid the dinner rush. We got to cpk around 5. It is currently 548 and we have not received our order or even been checked up on. Horrible service by staff and it is annoying to be ignored for so long. Spend your money somewhere else and don't waste your time.

Okay - three of us walked in at 8:30pm and were seated in the outside section. The place was full on a Tuesday nite.  We ordered 3 half salads, a pizza, and an appetizer.  30 minutes later nothing .  Then 2 of the 3 salads came out first.  We patiently waited - then the pizza came. We asked about the third salad - to which the waitress said - there was a delay because they were making fresh balsamic dressing??? Then we asked about the appetizer -later that came out in fourth place.  We had to ask about the missing salad again and was offered that it be boxed to be taken home instead - which, at that point sounded like a good idea. We ordered one dessert item to be shared- which did not take long to be brought to our table by another server working in the same section and after digging in - our waitress walked up to our table with the salad all boxed up and ready to go - except she held ANOTHER dessert - which wasn't meant to make up for the earlier mix ups - she was just as baffled as we were- and threw in the towel at that point.  But being the only bright spot of the evening - she left it with us - On The House.  My opinion - Hey Kitchen guyz - "You Killin' us Servers out here!!"   2 Stars because the waitress did the best she could with the bad hand she was dealt.  Kitchen cooks - I would be embarrassed -  just hang your head - no action hero status for you guyz - the wait staff may party after work -  but you guyz shouldn't be invited! Too bad for good o' CPK.  Everyone wants to love that place!!

Big thumbs down!!! Just came back from picking up a takeout order. Website said 9:01pm pick up time. At 9:10 food still wasnt ready. The restaurant was NOT busy. There was an over abundance of wait staff doing nothing and lots of empty tables.. My pizza sat on the counter cold while I waited for 2 Chinese chicken salads!!! By the time I got the order, pizza wasn't even warm. There was no utensils for the salads or napkins. The idiot at the take out counter was too busy trying to figure out how to use the adding machine properly instead of trying to provide decent customer service. The manager should be ashamed of themselves and whomever owns this particular franchise. Just because you are the only cpk on the windward side doesn't mean you can get away with shitty service. How about you try hiring people who give a shit. I'll drive into town next time and am definitely going to veto this cpk.

I go to Physical Therapy in Kailua, I live in Ewa Beach so before heading back on the H3 to the West side, my daughter & I usually stop by this CPK for lunch or dinner. I have had no problems in the past but on 8/18/15 we stopped in for a late lunch. We got seated pretty fast but it to forever for the waitress to come over to get our drink order. The restaurant wasn't busy, just a few tables, so I didn't know what was taking so long. Everything pretty much took a long time. My daughter got a pizza with chicken, lettuce, tomatoes & Avocados. I ordered the chicken fettuccini. My food was bland and tasteless, and my daughter decided just to eat the veggies off her pizza because the crust was making her full. While she was taking off the lettuce she found a dead fly under the lettuce. I called the waitress over, and she said "did that just get there", pretty much accusing us of putting the fly there. I told her to take that pizza off my bill, and once again I guess whoever the night manager was, it took forever for her to give me back the bill. There was no apology for the fly being on the pizza that my daughter almost ate. Bad service, and really poor management. I have not been back since. I know I'm not going to go there when that particular waitress and manager is working.i should call the health department.

Last spring a friend was in town and one night we just wanted a quick and simple meal.  We went into town and ordered take-out from CPK.  It's not my favorite pizza.  I've had it before in several locations in California.  The owners took a great idea (from a restaurant * in Foster City, CA) and made it their own.  It never has lived up to the original, but still, it's decent food.   We ordered a pizza and bread, and were told it would be, what, 1/2 hour?  It was a nice night so we walked around a bit and just hung out until it was time.  We went back and inquired about our pizza only to have the woman helping us look very confused and excuse herself for a minute.  The store manager came back and apologized profusely.  She said that our order had not been given to the kitchen, so it hadn't even been started.  If we still wanted to wait, she would comp the entire meal.  I'm sorry, but wow.   Pay attention business owners and managers, THAT'S how you keep your customers.  If you screw up, and it happens to all of us, make a grand gesture like that, or even a smaller gesture, but do something.  I've had far too many places screw up and not even make a small attempt to retain my business.  If we'd been in a hurry I suppose we would have been at least a little bit upset, but we weren't, so we weren't.  Like I said it was a beautiful night, so we went back outside for a while.  We lost nothing and the local CPK gained a favorable review from me. * The restaurant in Foster City, CA, was Pacific Gourmet Pizza.  The original owners sold it years ago, and while the pizza was still really good after that, I have no idea if it still is.  I don't even know if it's still owned by the same people who bought it from the original people.

Went recently with my bro and it was good.  We got our food in a timely manner.  The waitress was helpful.  The food was good got the new healthier dish with zuccini and shrimp scampi it was good and pretty filling.  I think it only had 530 calories but I could be wrong.  I recommend going here if you are in Kailua or in the area. Well thats all I have to say so peace out and chill it and have a nice day.

I ordered on-line about 45 minutes before arriving & was told they never received my order =( I should have checked for a confirmation e-mail. Luckily, Rachelle & her manager were very helpful. I was already in a rush to bring dinner to my boyfriend who was on duty & was told the food would take 10-15 minutes. I figured it would be 15 but my order was ready in 8! I was so surprised & happy! The food was hot & smelled delicious, just like CPK food always does. I won't be ordering on-line ever again but thank you Rachelle & your manager for making me & a very hungry Marine extremely happy =D Service like this is why we make the drive from town to come here instead of going to Ala Moana.

Went to CPK today with my family for lunch.  It wasn't crowded and we were seated right away. Our waitress was Valerie and she gave us terrible service. We waited 20 mins. for sodas. We also asked for bread for my 23 month old child to hold him over until we got our food. After waiting 20 mins. for just bread, we tried to get Valerie's attention, but she was too busy talking and joking around with 2 other waiters.  Finally, one of the waiters told her that we were trying to get her attention. Instead of coming to our table at that moment, she finished her conversation with her friends and then came over.  We told her we were waiting for bread.  Needless to say, we received the bread after we were served our lunch.   Terrible service. Waiters and waitresses should be more professional and should not make customers wait 20 mins. for soda and bread.

my friend and i came here after a long day at the beach and kayaking.  the food hit the spot but something was lacking.  i loved the variety of lunch foods and they're all relatively inexpensive!  i ordered the spinach artichoke dip and the tuna melt panini and my friend got the tomato basil soup.  the soup wasn't anything special, just tasted like tomato paste.  my sandwich ok.  for a panini, i expected everything to be heated through and the cheese all gooey and delicious, hence, tuna MELT.  well, my tuna was cold and the cheese nowhere near heated.  although my bread had grill marks so i was confused :/  the spinach artichoke dip had a weird taste.  it tasted like it had been reheated after it was frozen or something, idk!  we didn't get sick from it so it was all g. overall, it's wasn't bad but it wasn't CPK standards for me.  inexpensive, but i wouldn't go here unless i'm in kailua and SERIOUSLY craving some spinach artichoke dip.

CPK has always been my favorite. The store's ambiance is good, if there are no crying and screaming babies... Atmosphere good as well as the food, I like sitting outside in the fresh air on a crisp evening, makes for pleasant dining.  My favorite is the bar b q chicken pizza, smothered with bbq sauce and cheese ono.  It's nice to see Richard back as a manager. He is great, does his job well and interacts with the customers, unlike many of the other managers.

KK is exactly right.  The take out salads are a rip off.  I haven't had dine in salads so I can't say if it would be bigger.   I love the regular CPK's and I have gotten take out from them.  So needless to say I was pretty disappointed.
I love this place...my experience with CPK started as a project for my MBA, so thought I'd try it.  I fell in love with the food, service, atmosphere...it's a great place to eat and relax.

Don't do take out on the salads!  If you're going to order a salad from here dine in.  The take out portions are small!   With that said, it's nice to have a CPK on the windward side.  It's a relaxed atmosphere and the salads are good.  Lately even on the weekend during peak lunch time (11:30 to 12:30) it's not that crowded.

CPKs are always good and consistent so you really cant go wrong with anything on the menu.  I came here with a large group around 2p and it was perfect because we were able to be seated right away. Since I was having my own entree and not sharing a pizza like usual,  I went with something that I always wanted to try, their sandwiches.  I got the turkey stack sandwich with slaw for 11.49 (+tax).  When it arrived it was pretty good, although the dijon mustard that they use is a little strong to me flavor wise,  and next time i'll just stick with regular mustard or none.  The slaw on the other hand was really delicious and I could have used more of that.  It was on the sweeter side but the acid balanced it out.  Our waitress was attentive and filled our waters.

While visiting family in Kailua, a relative and I thought we'd try out CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN.  After receiving our meal, the manager, a tall blondish woman, (looking very corporate) asked us to leave without any warning.. I can't for the life of me figure out her reasoning or lack of it.  I will venture to say that this employee is not a good representatIive of CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN and has only served to damage its reputation amongst the local community. Kailua is a closely knit town and word does get around. THE WORD IS NOT GOOD! Susan T.

I normally love CPK in Kailua! Usually good food and service. Tonight my friend and I took our children there and had a bad waitress called Renee, a short older caucasian looking woman! My friend got there first with her child, and Renee was chatting and laughing with her. Renee then proceeded to ignore me and my child almost the whole time we were there. Even to take our orders, she wouldn't make eye contact and she was most of the time pretending we weren't there. I almost felt invisible. :( She didn't bring me water as I requested and when I paid the check, she just kept her eyes on my friend. Very unfriendly service from Renee! The only thing I could think of was maybe she was racist. She sounded vaguely British and was haole and I'm Indian , so maybe that was it.... hmmm  it was very strange, and I didn't like her one bit! again, terrible service from Renee!!!! Tip to her, make eye contact with all your customers at a given table and pay attention to ALL of them ! Jeez!

The trip started good since there was no wait but quickly turned sour as the host took us to our table threw the different menus on the table making a pile of booklets  and left without a care in the world.  Not to mention it was my wife's birthday and she had gone to the restroom while i was been seated and I had my 2 year old in my arms asleep so there was no way for me to fix them before she came back.  Although it was a rough start our waitress did make it up for us by been extremely nice although she did get our order wrong she apologized for it and asked if we wanted it changed.  Over all good food but the host should definitely be more careful about what he is doing and care about all the tables the same, since i did notice he was carefully placing the menus on other customer's tables nice and neat.  Coming into the restaurant, the host gives the customer their first impression of what to expect.  I did give it a 2 star though because our first time at this location was amazing and sadly did not experience the same thing on what was suppose to be a special night for my wife.
I love their flatbread and of course pizza. Their gluten free pizza is awesome. They are always busy, and we waited for 45 min, and it is little bit expensive.

Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Organization: 3/5 Atmosphere: 3.5/5 This is really going to be a mixed review. I have been to several CPK locations on both Oahu and in California, but I have never taken the time to actually analyze multiple aspects of this chain restaurant before. This time, I decided to pay a little more attention to detail and actually see if there are any improvements that could be done to this place. First off, the food. The food actually isn't that bad. Size proportions in comparison to price are decent though like most places, if you decided to make it on your own from scratch, it would save you a few bucks here and there. Haha. However, it's not too unreasonable when you want a nice little luncheon or dinner with friends and family. I will say that the pizzas and pastas are flavorful to a decent degree, but there is usually a smidge of a spice or sauce that is lacking that might actually bring the dish to life. But that's personal preference. Overall, the food is good. A must try is the Original BBQ Chicken Salad. That is amazing! The service was really good when my mom and I stopped in as far as the hostess and the waitress at the bar were concerned. They were amazing and very friendly and took responsibility when they forgot something. It was during lunch time so business was busy. Which then leads me to the organization. For some reason I got this sense that there was very little communication between the staff. One big peeve was how the expediters were more into their conversation than making sure the food was presentable and getting them out to the customers in a timely fashion. Our food actually was sitting there for a good 10 minutes or longer before the waitress (who had been running around taking care of her other customers) had to ask them to take the food to us. While the food was still good, the Baja Fish Tacos we ordered were a bit soggy on the bottom which is from a combination of the sauce that is put on top and the fact that they were waiting on the table for a while. The atmosphere is very nice and the restaurant is clean for the most part with both an inside and outdoor component so that way you can choose your environment. However, it was the confusion that I sensed that day that really didn't make it all too much of a comfortable eating environment but it's not totally unpleasant either. All in all, I'm willing to go back there for a simple meal with friends and family again. I just won't be expecting customer service that's going to blow me out of the water all around. Just from a few people who actually care about their job. But I do look forward to going back and experiencing some of their other dishes, especially the new ones.

We ate lunch here and were very happy with the food and the service. We had the barbecue chicken pizza which sounds strange, but is delicious. We also had a Hawaiian pizza, delicious also. The Mai Tai's were excellent! We'll be back on our next vacation for sure!

I went there yesterday, in the hopes of eating a dessert.  I had gotten my 20% yellow Adventure card in the mail, which expires on my birthday.  They didn't have any new desserts that I could get with my yellow discount card.  The red velvet dessert didn't count as a "new" item.  I ended up reading their third cookbook and then left.  I already have their first two cookbooks. 9/1/10  Vicky and I went out for my early birthday, shared the five cheese pizza, and the hummus as an appetizer.  They had a new non-chocolate dessert that I am going to have to try out.  I'm going to have to use my mystery contest coupon before it's expiration in October 2010.
Great food! And during lunch great service! I always get the BBQ chicken salad with avocado, spin dip with pita and chips, and Sedona tortilla soup!

Visit: 8/6/09 - Dinner.  Had the BBQ pizza, spinach dip and garlic pasta. BBQ pizza was small compared to other CPK's.  Taste was not as good.  Kinda dry and it had a funny smell.  Price was the same as other CPK's so smaller pizza, same price makes this pizza more expensive. Spinach dip was okay.  Chips were stale so not that good. Garlic Pasta was good.  I liked the sauce and the chicken. No real service so we didn't tip much.  We had to get our own drinks and bus the table. Prices were pretty expensive.  They made this place a take out counter style restaurant so no free bread, seat yourself, get your own beverage and they charge the same as a regular CPK.  So price is expensive.  You miss out on all the extras.  We spent around $28 for the 2 of us on 3 dishes. I don't talk about environment too much, but this restaurant has the feeling of being dirty.  I did not feel clean while eating here.  Maybe if I ate outside it would have been better. I would not come back here.  Not worth it to me.  Also the menu had less items.  I guess that is why they call it ASAP.

We love coming here and sitting on the outside railing because we can bring our dog.  We tie him to the railing and he enjoys watching the people.  Since he's cute, he gets his share of attention, especially when it's busy and people are waiting. The children's menu has great choices and bottomless drinks!  Our son loves the kiwi twist. We aren't wild about the pasta, but really enjoy the Chipotle Chicken Pizza, Fresh Mushroom pizza, and Meatlover's pizza.  The grilled vegetable sandwich is also very good.  The tortilla soup is fantastic. The wait staff is usually very friendly and does a great job boxing up our leftovers. The only complaint is that they don't take reservations and when it's busy, the wait is just too long. . .

Went for lunch on a Saturday.  Got a table right away, however, it took about an hour and a half for our food to come.  While we were waiting, two other parties were seated near us and received their food, paid and left before were were even served.  Finally, our server came out and said our food would be coming out soon, no explanation.  (It was not very busy at all, and I could see that their was plenty of staff working) when our food finally came out, I was about to take a bite of my pizza (yes, the one that took an hour and a half to make) and discovered there was a black hair about an inch long sticking out of my pizza crust.  I notified our server who apologized and said she would have a new one made for me.  Being that I already had to wait an hour and a half for the first one to come out, I thought maybe they would have expedited the new pizza......well I waited another 45 minutes and the server came out and said, "oh, your pizza should be coming out soon, it's still cooking."  At that point, I asked her to put it in a takeout box when it was ready.  I have eaten at other CPK locations during extremely busy times of the day, and I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes.  there is no way that it takes over 45 minutes for the pizza to cook, it would have been burnt.  Meanwhile (still waiting) one of the cooks came out of the kitchen with his own meal, set it down on the table, then proceeded to walk around the restaurant taking off his hat and shaking his shaggy longish hair all over, and kept running his hands through his hair.....I'm pretty sure that's where the hair in my pizza came from.  Finally my new pizza arrived, we asked for the bill, and when that finally came, discovered that they took off the charge for the pizza.....so for that, I give them a star.  Server was friendly but overall service was poor and forgetful.  Don't think I will be coming back to this location.
didn't have to wait to be seated perfect...the atmosphere is good here in kailua!!! mike is an awesome waiter.. will be back again

Did another visit to Kailua CPK. They really have improved in the last two months my first review was scathing. They took my suggestions is offered and the place really functions well. There is an air of team work now that didn't seem present before. I actually enjoy meeting friends and hanging out for lunch. Great job!

Best CPK I've been to! The manager of this place know how to run a tight shift. I originally started going her for their coupon promotion, but I keep going back for the BBQ chicken pizza. The best appetizer is the avocado egg rolls, the sauces set it off! This place hooks you up: if the pizza is taking you too long, they hook you up with a discount or sometimes it's on the house. They will have my repeat business because of their staff's professionalism and customer service. Keep up the great work!

I love pizza but this place is terrible!! I only end up here if I'm outnumbered in a decision. The staff is friendly but the food is half-assed. I'd rather spend my money on food with fresh, local ingredients. Drinks are okay, hence the one star.

I'm happy to say I have not ever experienced the bad service or food others have posted about the CPK in Kailua. I live on the West side and make the trip to Kailua from time to time in order to eat somewhere out of the norm.  My wife and I were greeted by several employees upon arrival and out server Katie could not have been better. The food was great, our drinks and bread were refilled promptly and Katie checked back often. When we left, several other employees thanked us as we were walking out. My wife had the wedge salad, soup, and sandwich and I had the jambalaya. As usual, neither if us had any complaints and were happy we made the trip.

Had my first meal of 2011 here. We split a Waldorf salad, Sicilian Pizza, and I had a Kiwi Lemonade. The service was very good, the waitress was very attentive and funny. The pizza was hot and spicy with just the right amount of cheese. The Waldorf salad was excellent, something about candied walnuts that make me giddy. The Kiwi lemonade was a little too sweet for my palate. Overall experience was good, we sat outside in the lanai area and watched the world go by.
Food was delicious as usual. It's a little smaller then the CPK were used to but just as awesome. Staff was outstanding and the food was perfect. Would go here again,again and again for sure!!!

This is a place we usually go to when we can't decide on what to eat because of the wide menu.  Also, we've never had to wait for a seat which is always a plus!  The staff is always friendly and the establishment is always clean.  The food has had a few misses (carnita tacos) with me but overall we've never had a problem and have always had a pleasant experience.

Nice Friday night. Not too crowded. Prompt service.  Our server had a big section and was still really quick and attentive to our needs. Very friendly and always smiling, Kristen did an awesome job. The food came out quick. My son enjoyed his barbecue chicken pizza and my salad was good as always

So my husband and I come to CPK when we don't want to take the trip to the other side of the island. I love their ranch! Well we had a very upsetting experience the last time we were there. I have been a waitress in the past and therefore I can be very understandable. So here's our list. 1. when seated our table was wobbly 2. our appetizer came before our drinks 3. We were ignored the whole night and the other larger parties around us that our waitress had were getting plenty of attention. 4. my drink was empty all night 5. When the check came we paid with our card and put my husbands military I.D. in with it. (We were told last time they finally had a military discount.) Well our waitress informed us that she has been working there for 3 years and she has never heard of that.  6. After insisting she ask a manager she learned her lesson. The customer is always right.  By the end of the night we just wanted to get out of there.  P.S. Our waitresses name was Valerie and I am not the only person on here that has had crap service from her.
Actually it is a full service spot now and they do curbside pickup!  Great food, fun atmosphere tons of local shops within walking distance.

We get to CPK 2-3 times a year and are usually satisfied over all. However this most recent time, much of their flatware and some plates were dirty. Upon unwrapping the flatware from the napkin, 4 out of the 12 pieces were either stained with grease, had unsightly water spots or in one case, had old lettuce stuck to it. The pizza and salad came and when you grabbed the plate, the underside of the lip was sticky on one and had some caked on food on another. There were only 4 of us so those odds are pretty high for dirty serving things. We did let the manager know and he did take 20% off the bill, but knowing we were eating off of things that were less than spotless made us uncomfortable. I would rather pay full price, and expect quality service all the way around. On the upside, our server was good and attentive. That was a plus.

ASAP is right, they made their food super quick! I like this location a lot more than the ones in town because it's quick and it seems better quality-wise.  Most dishes are under $10 and range from pizzas to pastas, and salads.  Refillable drinks too if ya dine in ;) It was pretty empty when we went in, it was around 3pm.

This is the first time I have been to this chain restaurant. I have seen California Pizza Kitchen in other cities and have never been before. My husband and I went on a Sunday night and it was slow. We ordered an appetizer though and got that and our food literally minutes later maybe 3 or 4. The waitress kept apologizing but she gave it us and by the time we ate our food 15 min later it was cold. I got pasta so the cold pasta didn't taste that great. I would have rather they left the food under a heat lamp even rather than bringing our food out right after our appetizer. We even ordered our appetizer when she first came to the table and then ordered our food after that the next time.  I don't send food back anymore because to be honest I don't know what will happen to it if I do.  She really didn't come back until the end to ask if everything was ok. When she did I told her that our food was cold by the time we got to eat it and I'm sure it could have been better had it been hot. She just apologized again and  did nothing about it. Maybe she was just new but I would expect at least a free desert or something next time minimum. I would think a chain restaurant would have done something more than nothing. That is just my opinion. Oh and I will never go back here. I could get a frozen meal and stick in the microwave for the same taste and spend way less. I gave my opinion to the manager who called me and offered us free dinner if we came back to try them again. It was a very nice gesture. I think the food was ok the second time. I still miss Olive Garden though for my chain Italian food!

Went here today 2/17/11 with my daughter. Forgot my camara though... Instant seating, polite front of house guy, Tiffany ( our server) was excellent!  Very pleasant...Had the Jose Cuervo margarita (Top Drawer!) Thanks Bartender!  We had 2 pizzas that we would never had gotten any where else: the pear/gorgonzola and the buffalo chicken. Both were really good. Definatley will order the buffalo chicken pizza again. Yum!  We were seated immediately and served within 20 minutes!  Outstanding CPK! Even when we left, the front of the house guy was there waiting with the door open. So COOL!

This is not an ASAP any more.  It is now a standard California Pizza Kitchen.  Still good food, just a little more expensive.  In return, you get a longer menu and a comfortable restaurant experience.  I'm usually alone, so I don't notice the noise that other people speak of.
What can I say, it's a California Pizza Kitchen.  Having more options to eat in Kailua is good.
Had lunch there yesterday ...The server "Magic" was the best. Fast, friendly service...the best service I've had anywhere. Also, the food was better there than the Pearl Ridge CPK.

This place has gone downhill I am was very disheartened to discover that they are now using iceberg lettuce for the BBQ chopped ckn salad, and it was hardly chopped  the California club pizza was absolutely terrible - no flavor whatsoever- unless you like to eat mayonnaise straight out of the jar.  The hummus was good. The cheese pizza and the Mac and cheese were on point

Overpriced crap... Sandwich bread was so hard it cut my gums open... There was only a small amount of meat on the sandwich... Ate 1/2 took the rest home and ended up pitching it in the trash! All this after waiting 20 min to get a seat and paying outrageous prices!!! $60.00 for 4 people!!! 2 sandwiches and 2 personal sized pizzas...

SERVICE SCORE!!!!! I am giving this CPK location 4 stars. The food was just so so but the service was on point. Egg roles were worth the calories but the club sandwich is worth passing up. Kids meals were perfectly proportioned but a little pricey when you factor in pizza, fruit cup, & ice cream cup.  Mike "Sides" was outstanding! If I could have him work for my company I would snatch him up in a heartbeat. He anticipated and delivered everything we could have ever needed and with a 4 year old to entertain, that alone speaks volumes. Everything out of this guys mouth was extremely witty and fun. He definitely made our night. Thank you!  Make sure to ask to be seated in his section!

CURB SIDE PICK UP!! =)  We ordered take out from CPK in Kailua this past weekend and were pleasantly surprised that they offer curb side pick up!  The CPK is located next to Macys in Kailua.  When we placed the order, they started to ask us about the color/type of car we drive so we asked why they needed this info.  Apparently, there were 2 reserved stalls right outside the restaurant that you can park at if you do take out.  Simply call the restuarant when you arrive to the stall and they will bring out your order AND take care of payment.  I thought this was such a nice touch since their parking is limited in the area and I could see how picking up could be a pain.  Wish all the CPK locations offered this service.  Definitely a plus!! Food tasted good as usual!  My garlic cream fettucine was extra good tho!  I noticed that certain CPK's cook the sauce differently, but I LOVE the way they cooked it =) Delicious!!

I've been here a couple times before and I've never had to wait so long before, me and my 2 other friends where waiting 15 minutes and had the pager that would designate us for seats, a group of 4 just came in and where immediately sat while we where still waiting for our pager to go off, we where then sat 5 minutes after and waited HALF an HOUR, the manager was a complete sweet heart but they sent a waitress named Katie to help us get our orders, this waitress passed us 3 times and helped everyone else that was already taken cared of, honestly very sad experience....

Not a big fan of chain restaurants but this was a great lunch. Nice outdoor seating, lots of parking and good service. The Cobb and Thai Chicken salads were excellent. Got the 1/2 salads and each was extremely large. The "works" pizza was the best - with the sausage being the high note. Only disappointment was the 5 cheese pizza, with tomato slices, which was a little short on flavor.

This cpk never seems to disappoint amazing food and awesome staff.... I love coming here even if it's just for a snack... I made a takeout today and SAM helped me she was very joyful that was really nice to see especially during the holiday season... Only one little bad note.... They should hire our have a little more pleasant hostess I think her name tag said PADMA she didn't have much personality but I would let that change my review..

Well its a small cpk to begin with so there are times where you have to wait for a table. Overall service isn't bad and their dishes have always been delicious and I have always gotten a refill on my drink as soon as I finish it.

Compared to all other CPK's I've been to, this location is pretty nice. For being a busy Friday night the service was pretty quick, our waiter was attentive. As far as the food, compared to all other CPKs I will say here was lightly better. I ordered their garlic fettuccine. It was creamy and just garlicy enough. I was happy.

This place was alright for my first visit. I got the chicken Margarita fettuccine, or whatever it's called. I'd say it's really expensive for the portion given. But I'd give the taste of the pasta itself a 3.4 star out of 5. It costed me $16, and it should of been $10-$12. I could get a lot more with that kind of money at Bucca's or The Cheesecake Factory for a 4 star meal in my opinion.   The wait wasn't long at all, they didn't seem too busy. The waitress was very polite and nice. Tended to us often so it was great not having to track someone down to get us refills.  I'm giving a 3 because they don't have an option of half a star. They are definitely not a 4, nor near it. It's an alright place to go, not some fancy omg I have to go here its a total foodgasm resteraunt. Probably won't go here again for a loooong time. I just don't think my money is worth it, especially for pasta.
Tonight we celebrated our dear friends birthday. Noel and Magic made us all feel SO special!! Wonderful evening for all. We LOVE Kailua CPK!!!!
Very impressed, my first time eating at a California pizza and it was great. Appetizer was great.chips and guac. Will definitely go again.

We went on Good Friday.  It was busy but we were seated at an inside table very quickly. The service was good - very attentive server.  The food was tasty as well. Love the Spinach artichoke dip and Chicken caesar sandwich. My only complaint is something that is an organizational issue not unique to this location. The suggested tip amount on the bottom of the check calculated based on teetotal including tax.  It should be on the subtotal since the tax is an add on, not reflective of the service, and varies by county and state.  Please look into changing this.  It's deceptive.

I have always enjoyed CPK, since the '90's. The last time I was here in Kailua CPK was 2 years ago. We went at a non-rush time, 3:30pm. Service was ok ( I've worked the bar & restaurant business for 40 yrs, so I do know good, attentive service.). Our waiter was nice, but, he seemed distracted, we didn't get any silverware till we already received our food. My main reason for writing this is the food. It tasted good. My garlic cream fettuccine w/shrimp & mushrooms tasted good, but watery. My husband's bolognese was dry...not enought sauce. I asked for half salad but got a full one. After we left, I got tremendously ill. Stomach cramps and the feeling of throwing up. I'm also sensitive to too much salt, and I know restaurant food has more salt & fat then home cooking. I had wretched headaches all night long, and it made my temperature soar to 102*. I know you think maybe I got a cold but actually it's response to high salt...for me. I look up the nutritional value on line, my fettuccine had 1200 calories, and over 1100 grams of salt, then there's the cesaer salad. So today, the day after, I'm still having a few unhappy feelings. It would help if they had a low sodium menu or at least listed the nutritional values in the menu. i won't be eating here any more. If your salt sensitive, you may want to think twice. Mahalo for letting me vent.

CPK. When it's good, it's really, really good, but when it's bad it's horrid. It's been a little like a ferris wheel in here, starting out at the bottom, soaring to the heights of redemption, only to slide back down to the bottom. As a new location, the experience was so terrible that I didn't return for a year. After that, things seemed to have improved. But alas, it didn't last, with the restaurant having recurring problems with the food (getting the order wrong) and service (inattentive and/or clueless). I've even been given dirty plates, so it's a little like an adventure--you never know what kind of experience you'll have.  Fortunately, things have been somewhat better lately, so I'm giving CPK four stars, at least this time around. The taste of the food has been what has kept me coming back despite the numerous hiccups in service. They offer honey whole wheat crust (yum!) and thin crust in addition to regular white crust. They also have a "small cravings" menu with appetizers and app-sized selections--a nice touch. In addition to the typical soft drink choices, they have Italian sodas and sugar-free Italian sodas, plus a full bar. CPK is a popular chain, so there is typically a wait at dinnertime, especially later in the week or on the weekend. Coming on Thursday night is just asking for trouble, since the adjacent farmer's market keeps this place hoppin' more than usual. Lanai seating is generally first available if you're willing to sit outside.  The Kailua CPK is in the heart of Kailua Town and is situated next to Pier One, next to Macy's, on the mauka side of Kailua Rd. Parking is not normally a problem, since there is a full-sized parking lot plus a two-story parking garage nearby (although these are shared). If you are carrying out your order, you can pull up in the driveway opposite the front door, and someone will meet you at your car. Hours are Mon-Fri, Sun 11:30am-9pm; Sat 11:30am-10pm. I always order the grilled chicken caesar salad and it's always amazing! A great spot to meet a friend or bring some family on a night out. The pizza is always great and everyone always enjoys it :)

Honestly, when I first started eating at CPK this is the only location I've been to on the island. My BF always complained about the quality of food here and I now see why! I finally got the chance to eat at another CPK in Ala Moana shopping center and there was a huge difference in the quality of food we got there. Every time we at at the CPK in Kailua the food is horrible in comparison to other CPKs. We usually get the Thai chicken pizza and they always seem to mess it up here at the Kailua location, not enough sauce, burnt crust, pizza is cut unevenly, all the topping on one side or not enough toppings at all. The egg rolls here are always mushy too. The service is usually always great and they have a server named Mike who is amazing at customer service. The food expo guy and the back of the kitchen really need to get on track with how the food should be served. Anyone else who has been to another CPK will understand...

Usually when you think of CPK, everyone has good thoughts and a favorite menu item or two.  Kailua CPK has really gone down the tubes.  Our waiter was nice and friendly but seemed like the kitchen kept messing up... well, he never did refill our water either.  The service here is just painfully slow... Lately everytime I go I am left feeling some how disappointed... and this last time was the last straw.  It's crazy how busy it always is but I think if they keep up what they are doing, slowly the people will leave as well...  The chips seemed stale... my friend ordered her Thai Crunch a special way with avocados. It came out wrong. Whoever is heading up Kailua CPK now...needs to really rethink what they are doing...  My experience isn't a stand alone one. Talking to a few others they have had bad service/food as well... so it's not just a one night fluke...

This chain delivers fast mostly fresh food.  There are much better restaurants in town but this is a good choice especially if you are trying to accommodate different palates.  Good for kids and families.  The downside is that you could be anywhere -  it is a chain.
